Reviews.Title: “With a good rate it's fine..”
Reviews.Author: Ken F
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer said, "It's a hotel" Nothing special. The rooms are kind of tucked together at weird angles so it felt like you were entering a closet to get to your room. We had two rooms and all four keys to those rooms stopped working at the same time. The front desk person, instead of apologizing and just reactivating our keys, immediately placed the blame on us saying we kept the keys too close to our cell phones or credit cards. One problem with that is that one of the keys had never left the dresser except to verify that the keys weren't working. You never blame the customer with your first reply.. Some Customer Service training is certainly in order.. This was a one time trip to Chicago but if by chance we do return we probably wouldn't stay here again. Too many better choices close by..

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when booking!!!”
Reviews.Author: csjohns7
Reviews.Content: I screwed up, the Crown Plaza is totally within their rights in how they handled this situation, but it left a bad taste in my mouth. I was looking for a hotel in Chicago for my Bachelor party in September. I liked the rate, location and reviews of the Crown Plaza Magnificent Mile so I went ahead and booked five rooms with queen beds for 2 nights each. This is where I screwed up. I selected the best rate of $234 a night for the rooms. This was among the first group of rates listed. What I did not realize was that the first group of rates on top the the results page was the non-refundable advanced purchase rate. I completely glanced over this, that is my fault. I've booked quite a few hotel rooms in the past, and have never seen the non-refundable rates listed on top of the search results and with no significant warning posted near them. Nore did not get any sort of warning before I clicked the "book it" button, alerting me that this was a non-refundable purchase. But, my fault I should have double checked and done my due diligence. I panicked when I saw I had just put $2500 on my credit card and called Priority Club to see if there was anyway I could cancel this. I admitted I screwed and said I was willing to re-book the same amount of rooms at the normal rate (which was only $1 more!!) for the same weekend. I made this call about 30 seconds after booking. The Priority Club rep said there was nothing they could do, and I would have to contact the hotel directly. I contacted the hotel directly and talked to Mary in reservations. I explained my problem, acknowledged that it was totally my fault but if there was anything they could do I would greatly appreciate it and that I would re-book the same amount of rooms at the higher available rate. Mary said that there was nothing she could do, and that I would have to contact Priority Club directly. I told her that PC had sent me to her. She said they were wrong and that I would have to call them back. I called Priority Club back and passed along what Mary at the hotel had said. The Priority Cub rep was very understanding and helpful and again said there was nothing she could do and that once the hotel has a non-refundable advanced purchase reservation booked it's totally up to them to cancel it. Which makes sense and I understand. So, I tried Mary in reservations one last time. This time she gave me a huge attitude, said that the Priority Club people lied to me and that she would contact them herself and have them call me. That was five hours ago, no call. So I get it, the hotel got their money out of me upfront and they are totally within their rights to keep it. They are at the whim of people canceling reservations so when someone pays up front they are going to keep that money. But I just hate the way they went about it. kind of misleading website aside, Mary in reservations straight up lied to me twice, once with attitude. I'm a big boy if you want to keep the money I paid and are within your rights to keep it I understand. But don't lie to me and say there is "absolutely nothing you can do" and only Priority Club could cancel the reservation. The funny thing is I 100% plan on making this trip, and will have 20 people coming with me. I was planning on booking 5-10 additional rooms later this month on top of the five I already booked, but I guarantee those additional rooms will not be at this Crown Plaza. In addition I plan on never saying at a Priority Club property again. I screwed up, I get that. But you're in the hospitality industry, you can be a little nicer about it.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel... In an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: newsformaggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just one block off the Magnificent Mile, which also puts it within a short walk of the lake and metro stops. The location is superb, but it's "just a hotel," if you know what I mean. Good, but nothing spectacular. The room was clean, the bathroom has a hair dryer... But the room has an odd layout and for the price, I was disappointed that you had to pay $9.95 a day for WiFi in your room. Really? Staff was friendly and helpful and let us store our bags after check out on our last day before heading out that afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Left very confused and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: heidygoercke
Reviews.Content: My husband bought a coupon from living social. The package included a one night stay at one of their suites with a romantic dinner. 03/02/12 Friday late afternoon my husbands calls me and tells me he is going to run a little late from work and since it started snowing outside, i was worried we will not be able to make our reservation. At 4:30 I called the front desk and spoke to a Lady, and explained her the situation, she told me that the restaurant stops serving at 10:30pm, however since we bought the package deal, we would be able to use it for a breakfast or lunch the next day. If we arrive to late at the hotel. Since we could t reschedule the reservation, because it was less then 24 hours. Which all was totally understandable and fine with me. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30pm. Another lady at the front desk checked us in and and we told her that we would be not having our dinner anymore but use it for the breakfast in the morning. As we 'had" to leave the city by noon. She took our living social receipt and said it was fine, but she never returned us our voucher or receipt. Later as we arrived in our room, i saw the guest book and saw that the sky lounge offered breakfast in the morning, so i called the front desk again, to confirm that "We are having the breakfast at the sky lounge" the next morning. And the lady at the phone said, that would be ok. The next morning we go upstairs to the sky lounge and told the bartender that we are guest trough living social. And he just sat us and asked us what we wanted to drink. As we proceed downstairs to the checkout counter, we received a final bill of an additional $70. Which we did not quite understand except the $12 for tax. We thought we were using our free breakfast from the package. But the lady at the front desk informed us that we had the breakfast at the sky lounge and it was going to be an additional $58, and she told us that we had used our breakfast voucher at the wrong place??!! And see, this is why i would never come back. Throughout our whole entire stay at this hotel, my husband and me encountered different types of service people. We spoke to different people at the front desk over the phone and in person, and even the waiter upstairs, and every single one of them failed to tell us that we could not use our dinner from the elephant bar at the sky lounge upstairs. even though we told each one of them that we were with living social. At checkout I finally talk to the same lady that i called the previous day about our reservation. But i did not like how she handled this situation at all or how she treated me. She said that she informed me that i was able to use it for a lunch or dinner. and thats fine, however she failed to inform me that they had 2 different restaurants inside the hotel. We ended up paying $58 additionally, as she refused to make an adjustment. Even though every single one of her staff members including herself failed to inform us properly.I felt very unhappy as we left the hotel and would def. not be able to make a recommendation upon my experience . I expected a little better, since it was advertise as a 4 star hotel. By the way we never used our food "voucher" as we had to leave the city by 12noon. Thank you very much, Heidy Goercke

Reviews.Title: “Corner Suite on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: kariejeanne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a groupon special and scored a king bedroom suite for a great price. Check-in was fast and easy and my husband presented his Crowne rewards card so we got a coupon for a free drink at Elephant and Castle (right by lobby) and a 15 percent off coupon for breakfast buffet at the sky lounge (which we didn't use). They were very gracious about all my requests, room high up, late check out and we were happy with the room. Lots of big windows and a living area. My daughter slept on the sofa bed, which was "springy" but the kind bed was comfortable. Nice bedding. Plasma tv in the corner surrounded by windows and great views of lake and city. Overall, nice and clean although the grab bar in the shower had some mildew around the bottom. Our room had updated surroundings and we had a solid 4 star experience here. I was glad we were in a bigger room, and I probably wouldn't have been as happy in a regular one. We've stayed at Crown's before and never really liked them. We did not eat at the sky bar for breakfast. I think it was around $17 for adults and 10 for kids. Easier to just walk to the corner bakery across the street and get a panini for $4. No in room movies, which we usually get for the kids so that was a bummer but oh well. Don't touch anything in the honor bar, there are sensors and you'll be charged. Also the pool is outdoors, which we didn't understand from the groupon so my kids were bummed. I'd stay there again, as long as I could get the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Bad parking experience and slightly out dated.”
Reviews.Author: laporte1
Reviews.Content: I was upset about not being told i had to pick my vehicle up from valet by 2pm the following day. We went to pick it up at 3:30 and were charged an additional $20 (a total of $70 for less than 24 hours of parking!) The parking attendant woman kept saying their sign says to pick the car up by 2pm. We NEVER saw any signs because we used the valet at the hotel. While $20 isn't that much money it still left us with a bad taste in our mouths about the hotel. This hotel was clean, staff was friendly, but the bathrooms were very small. It's an older hotel so a lot of things weren't up to date. I can only give this hotel 3 stars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but average overall”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: Near everything. No restaurants on site, but with so many nearby It is ok. Ask for a corner room, high up as possible. Good concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza is right on Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: Fran B
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel participated in Groupon so my wife and I decided to give it a try. We are withing driving distance of the hotel so it was a nice get away. It was quite a deal for a king suite. Parking is attached to the hotel and although people that aren't use to city parking could be shocked at the price, we found it was within the norm for the area. Check in went smoothly - nice and quick. The staff was pleasant and created a nice welcome for us. They didn't make us feel like we were there "on a deal". We were on the 33rd floor of the Avenue Hotel and it was a corner room with large windows with a nice view of the magnicient mile. The room was nice and convenient to the elevator. The hotel seemed really busy but there was never a delay in the elevator as I saw people have commeted on. Both my wife and I felt the room was nicely furnished and clean. And the bed! Most comfortable nights sleep I've had in a while. We will look forward to staying at the Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LLUncoolJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza February 4-5, 2012 for a quick family getaway. Our room was a corner suite on the 22nd floor. From the bedroom, we had a nice view of the corner of Michingan Ave & Huron (could see right down inside the sky window of the Apple Store). The room was nice. It had a desk, a hide-a-bed. flat screen TV, and minibar-fridge in the living room. The bathroom was standard, clean, nothing out of the ordinary for a hotel. The bedroom had a king size bed and a TV. All pillows including the extras for the hide-a-bed were feather down. The room was very clean, no complaints at all. The lobby was nice enough, but there wasn't much going on. Check in was quick and easy. Never had to wait long for an elevator. We checked out the sky lounge for sunday brunch, but didn't eat. It was a little pricey for the limited buffet. It did have a great view. The pool is on the roof, but was obviously closed and drained being it was February. I had read other reviews about the noise. My kids did remark that the noise from Michigan Avenue disturbed them a little. I had a long day and slept like a rock. Maybe the best aspect was the location. It is right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile. We took the kids to the Water Tower Place to the American Girl & Lego stores. It is only about 3 blocks north of the hotel. We lucked out and had pretty good weather for the season. If you're not from New York, it probably doesn't get any better than this if you are looking for a big city experience. Lastly, we got the room on Groupon and paid roughtly half price. We thought it was a very good deal. But even at full price, I still think it is a good option for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst front desk service ever.”
Reviews.Author: k8eq
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was great. Checking in with Sara, however, was certainly not. You would think that a place like this could afford to pay a more courteous staff! We will stay elsewhere next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Never slept better!”
Reviews.Author: LisaMarie1977
Reviews.Content: We had 3 king suites and they were excellent! The beds were very comfortable and both my husband and cousin said the woke up without back pain for first time in a long time. Rooms were very clean and updated. Check in was quick. Great location. It was a little noisy but didn't bother us. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: rebeccataigar
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and in need of updating. Also, the windows were really drafty, it almost felt like they were open. And the heater was so loud that we had to turn it off to get any sleep. And the windows were not only drafty, but you could hear all of the street noise, even though we were on a high level floor. Also the breakfast is really expensive, but it was good, and the service was good, I still found it very over priced. The biggest problem I had with the Crown Plaza was that the parking lot the next day took 2 and a half hours to get us our car, even though we called from our room to make sure they would have it ready after we checked out! If I had known we would have to wait so long, I would have gone shopping or walked around. We had to sit in the lobby for 2 and a half hours with a bored toddler, and when we complained to the front desk, they said that the parking didn't belong to them, so they had no control over it. There are much better hotels on the mile in the same price range, do yourself a favor and skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: jillbmac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. It was very clean, updated and comfortable. The bed slept great. The concierge service was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend away”
Reviews.Author: mimi91311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Crowne Plaza last weekend for two nights. We had a King Corner Suite on the 34th floor. No problem with hearing our neighbors, but the heating/cooling system was loud. The TV's are a bit outdated, but hey, they worked, so good enough. I was very surprised there were no outlets on the working desk. Also, one closet is totally hidden, so you have to go on a treasure hunt looking for hangars and the ironing board (or call the front desk as we did!) Also, as much as the suite was big enough for two, the pictures online are deceiving and much more generous than the actual size of the rooms. The location is great.....couldn't be better, and the staff (Benjamin at front desk) were so friendly and helpful. Overall a wonderful getaway, especially with a Groupon :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zoes1Mom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 block off Michigan Avenue in short walking distance to AG place and Water Tower. King suite is very spacious and comfortable with nice views. Only valet parking is available at a rate of $50 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Tyler W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for a little Chicago weekend getaway. We used our Priority Club points to book just a basic room, but upon arrival we politely asked for an upgrade since we were on our honeymoon, and they had the curosity of upgrading us to a junior suite. The hotel was nice, clean, and centrally located, however, we found it to be overall just average and had more of a business/airport hotel feel than a cozy/romantic hotel. There was an unattractive hole in our shower, paper-thin walls (we could hear people in the room next to us), and a few other little quirks in the room. There was really nothing necessarily "wrong" with the hotel, but for a Crowne Plaza boutique hotel, we just expected a little higher standard of amentiies, a different vibe and a more attentive staff. It was a nice place to stay in Chicago, but nothing too over-the-top. Overall nice, but wouldn't be our first choice place to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding guest services | Sarah, front desk agent”
Reviews.Author: Harvey B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the AVE Hotel during a weekend getaway to Chicago. Upon arrival we were greated by a wonderful front desk agent named Sarah. She went above and beyond her call of duty to make sure out stay was pleasant throughout the entire trip. The skylounge breakfast provided a standard hot breakfast buffet, with great views. The location / convenience / price combination of this hotel makes it a great place to base your stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Groupon saves this ...”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveling0609
Reviews.Content: We used our Groupon for a corner suite and only paid $120 versus the regular $250+ rate. I would never pay the regular rate for this room and would have been extremely disappointed if we had. Their website says this is a "urban boutique" ... it's not, in any way. But it's a perfectly fine $120/night hotel. Upon arriving, valet was not very helpful - I had to unpack the car by myself (and I'm 8 months pregnant). The lobby is very utilitarian and could use an update. The room was nice in regards to that it was a suite and we were traveling with a toddler so we appreciated the extra room. The rooms were big but could really use an update. Bed was comfy. The big desk chair sits awkwardly in front of the TV. Room service was mediocre and the girl that answered my call was very unknowledgeable about the menu. My biggest complaint is that I called valet to bring the car around as I needed to grab some forgotten things only to find that when I went downstairs the valet guy WALKED me to my car ... I'm in heels, very pregnant and am walking up (and then back down) a steep concrete ramp to my car only to have him say "hope you don't mind the exercise." We also had a problem with the card key and after making two trips to the front desk someone came up to let us in - an apparent problem with the lock. When I called valet to bring the car around the next morning, I was asked if we were checking out ... but never asked if someone could help us with our bags. This would have been nice. Also, when outside the valet guys were making fun of a homeless guy, which I found to be very tasteless. Location is perfect, but this isn't the type of hotel you "enjoy" visiting. Next time I'd rather pay a bit more money to stay somewhere a little nicer and more hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suprise”
Reviews.Author: gavinssidekick
Reviews.Content: Initally, had difficulty in booking a reservation using a purchased coupon from Groupon so we were a bit apprehensive going in. However we had a corner 1 bedroom suite with a great view of Michigan Ave, lake Michigan, it turned out great. I was glad we stayed, the room was great. Nice location for going to Chicago to shop on Michigan ave. Then to find out Garretts Popcorn in only two blocks away, what I nice suprise. If you've not had the cheese and carmel corn mixture, you have no idea what you're missing.

Reviews.Title: “Attention: Mik Mahadavi, My Compliments to Jenna Jung”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: I tried to submit this through the Crowne Plaza website, but it was not functioning. We had a great stay at your hotel. My family had a holiday outing in Chicago and we reserved 5 rooms for the night. I just wanted to compliment the lady that helped us check in. Her name is Jenna Jung. She was extremely polite, patient and helpful and went out of her way to get us the room types and locations we needed. She made all of us feel like valued guests. Please express our thanks to Jenna. Dennis Schulkins

Reviews.Title: “Noisy corner rooms”
Reviews.Author: NomadatLarge
Reviews.Content: Great location, quite clean but let down by the noise. We had the same experience as JohnDoe9. Arrived in the early evening to be told that our (pre-paid, well in advance) room was no longer available and would be like to pay for an upgrade? This really didn't impress my Priority Club Gold member husband and the receptionist wasn't interested after that. "Upgraded" room was on a lower floor and a corner room with glass on two sides - this meant waking up at least twice a night - as JohnDoe9 described - sirens (from the ER at the hospital on the next corner), whistles and quite loud heating system. I don't think this can be explained away by saying the hotel is in a big city, as clearly the other rooms don't have the same problem. A rating of three for location/nearby amenities/cleanliness but we would think twice about coming back, especially since there are so many other hotels (even in the same street).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: bargainbetty
Reviews.Content: we spent two nights here to wrap up 2011! The location is perfect to explore the Magnificant mile and close enough to walk to The Loop. Rooms - spacious, clean, comfortable beds, great Chicago photographs decorate the walls. They offer Neutrogena hair and bath products which is great! check in was easy and they offered us a free $5 Starbucks gift certificate if we would agree to not have maid service on 12/31. They said that it was part of their efforts to "Go Green". I enjoyed getting the coffee in exchange for the There is a restaurant attached that offered a good breakfast and many restaurant choices close by. There is an Apple store a half block away! They offer free classes throughout the day. It is a fun place to go explore if you like technology or own any Apple products. The only down side of this hotel is that they do not offer free wifi! The charge $10 per day for the password to access wifi but then you can get it in your room. Water Tower Place is only a couple blocks away along with access to many other shops, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: BizzyTravler
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night in a suite. Check-in was quick, easy, and staff was friendly. The suite was good. Not huge, but spacious enough. The furnishings didn't seem to match, but everything was comfortable. The bed was very comfortable - perfect night's sleep. Everything seemed clean and well-kept. You can't beat the location. Overall, and very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Alberto1265
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza is an excellent option in Chicago. The rooms are large, nice and clean. The location is excellent, many malls and shop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Steveky01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Fri-Monday. Great location, friendly staff, nice rooms. We were on 35th floor in a corner room and the views were great. Would recommend it. The meals in the adjacent Elephant and Castle restaurant were good but it was too much like an english pub for us as we were on holiday from UK! Found plenty of places to eat nearby

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoot5743
Reviews.Content: we won this hotel when we made a bid on Priceline. On Priceline it is considered a 4 star hotel. We got it for 140 a night when other websites were asking almost 300 a night for the same night. We stayed there for 1 night and had 2 queen beds because our kids were with us. The beds were very comfortable and the location of the hotel was excellent. We were within walking distance of many things. Staff was very friendly. I don't know if I would pay 300 a night for the room but I would consider paying 150 to 175 a night. The only negative thing was lots of sirens going off. It must be close to a firehouse or an ambulance company.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable cozy rooms and great comfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bren K
Reviews.Content: O.k , so this is not the Ellisian or the trump tower, but this hotel also does not come with the $500 - $800 a night price tag. I found the rooms to be updated, the beds to be very comfortable. The pillows were super comfy as well. Our standard king room was a little on the cramped side, especially the bathroom. However, everything was quite modern and I would recommend staying in this hotel. I did not hear any traffic from the expressway, but that was because my room did not face the expressway. I loved the lavender scented linen spray that the hotel provides. A couple of things that I did not like, you have to pay $10 day for Internet in your room. It is free in the lobby. Also, the gym was in need of new equipment. There is commercial grade lifefitness equipment, but it was old and many machines were broken. There is a seasonal outdoor pool on the rooftop, but it is missing the obvious, a hot tub. The best part of this hotel is that it is right on the mag mile. You can not find a better location to stay in downtown. You are right onion the heart of everything , right near Macys. Also, the service was excellent like you woul expect in any classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: queenie94
Reviews.Content: The room is a great size for a family of 4. The extra living area is welcomed. Can't say the same for the bathroom. Very tight quarters even for just one person!!! The area before the bathroom is wasted space. Would make for a large bathroom if renovated. At least have an outlet put in that area. So one person can do their hair/make-up while the other is using the facilities. The hotel location is ideal. Everything within a short walking distance. We even walked to Navy Pier in December!!! The hotel staff was amazing. A shout out to Verne(conceirge)Romeo, Benjamin, and Krasimira. You made our stay delightful especially for my boys. An honourable mention to Jael(office mgr) who was instrumental in helping us resolve an issue with the Airmiles and Priority Rewards people. She made sure we would have our problem resolved and done with satisfaction!!! Hope to see you guys in the spring/summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfuly rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: agillia
Reviews.Content: Booked this room with holiday inn points. The room was amazing with the living room seperate from the sleeping area. Fabulous location. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: Located just off The Magnificent Mile, this hotel has a lot going for it. The rooms that have a view of the Lake (certainly on the 37th floor) are spacious, having a sitting room and large bedroom with a wonderfully comfortable bed. The bathroom was a reasonable size (but no shower gel), and the shower was hot and with good pressure. Ambulance sirens were frequent, but that's due to the hotel's location in the hospital area. We did not eat in the hotel, preferring to try local outlets of which there are many in the area. Reception was pleasant, with some good advice about places to see and walking routes to take. Avoid rooms near the ice machines - they are ridiculously loud. All in all, this hotel is well worth it for the convenience of being able to get around the tourist spots easily.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit wasn't as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: danderism
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this Hotel. After the first visit I thought I found my hotel for my visits to chicago. I did get an upgrade to an executive suite but not a two room like before. the room and maid staff were very good. We did hear sirens on and off all night but this not the hotels fault. However the rest of the staff, something was missing The last time the staff greeted me and always had a smile and went out of the way to help. I would tell other hotels to send their staff to this property to see how to treat guests. I will have to rethink this. Instead of going out of their way to make me feel welcome it seemed that they wanted to avoid any unnecessary guest contact. I was not offered help with my luggage and bags when I was going to the car even after the bellhop asked me if I called for my car. The last visit I would have to fight them off from helping me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Inkapaul
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic - right downtown, within easy walking distance to everything. I didn't try the restaurant inside the hotel, but only because there was so much great food within just a few blocks. The only exception to the amazing, helpful, and welcoming staff was one overwhelmed and grumpy bellman. The room was small, but clean and very (very, very) comfortable. I stayed with a colleague while attending a conference, but families might find the double room a little tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Queen67
Reviews.Content: We arrived late due to airline cancellation but when the hotel couldn't accept my honors card they gave me an upgrade! when i didn't have my party pass they gave me a comp! walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and the Water Tower, Hersey,Ghiradelli, all the shopping you could ask for and a perfect spot for the hopper bus! Rooftop pool overlooking the city had an absolutely incredible view!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilfromWallsend
Reviews.Content: Hotel in Great location to explore this fantastic City.Hotel lovely and clean and staff very helpful.Has the added bonus of having the Elephant and Castle pub attached !! Rooms of good size too

Reviews.Title: “great location. comfortable room. good services”
Reviews.Author: lauriemom
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 days at the Avenue for business. A really great location if you plan on shopping (or window shopping) the magnificent mile. Walking distance to Loyola. The lobby pretty simple but I was pleasantly surprised to find I was provided a comfortable 2 room suite. The living space was quite dark and furniture a bit odd, but the bedroom was great with ample closet space, a second TV, and extra large windows on two sides. I am very picky about beds and sheets, I was not disappointed. Quite comfortable and lots of pillows. Yay! The bathroom was small and the tub did not want to drain, but after telling the front desk, it was all fixed the next day. Only major downside was the inconsistent wireless connection in the room. Frustrating. As were the painfully inadaquate elevators in the morning. Literally had to go up, to go down to the lobby as very elevator was packed when stopping at my floor. Not good when you're in a hurry. And of course, the $4 cokes in the mini-bar were irritating. But that was easily remedied by a short walk to the Walgreens to grab a stash of beverages, etc. As far as conference/business services (I was there for a multi-day, small group seminar)...the food was plentiful and very good (and waitstaff very accommodating). The room set-ups were more than adequate and conference wi-fi was fine. Overall, a very comfortable and conveniently located place to spend the week.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great....”
Reviews.Author: Gwen M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a weekend stay in Chicago this weekend. The location of The Avenue Hotel Crown Plaza is great; however, be advised if you have any intenion of getting sleep while you are visiting Chicago make sure you are not on the 38th floor of this hotel! The room we had was an adequate room but certainly not 4+ stars worthy. We were in room 3801 which was next to the three banks of elevators. All night long, for two nights, we were kept awake with the wind like sound every time the elevator went up and down. When I menationed it to the man at the front desk he said,"Oh that's too bad!" Also, make sure you contact the hotel prior to booking as the parking rate was $48 per night. We realize that we were parking in Chicago and that parking is a premium but it was an unexpected surprise at check in. We overheard other parties complaining about the parking fee as well so we were not the only guests feeling this way.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: rkidsrock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second trip to the Avenue in Chicago. Our experience was, again, one of our best in terms of hotel service. We had booked with Jael, Reservation Manager. When we got there we were greeted with incomparable personal attention by Jael. She really is a WONDERFUL person to deal with and is the primary reason we decided to return to this hotel. The entire staff is friendly and helpful...the stars: Jael (by far), Vern (concierge and king of all things Chicago: the man seriously knows his stuff when it comes to the perfect place to grab whatever you are looking for), Ben (front desk) and Robert (doorman). Each of these individuals are helpful, courteous and dedicated to making your day and stay wonderful. The rooms are beautifully appointed, very clean and very spacious. The beds are fabulous. In order to show integrity to "fair" rating I will say that the only knock on the rooms is the rain shower - really itâ€™s no more than a drizzle. The Elephant and Castle pub (attached to lobby) is fantastic for a drink as you come and go. The hotel is perfectly situated for shopping and restaurants on the Michigan Mile. Another knock, truly out of their control, is that the hotel is situated directly across the street from a large hospital...and all of its ambulances and their sirens. It has never kept us up at night, but is something to consider. Again, the location as a whole outweighs the hospital noise. If you are a shopper or foodie you will gladly endure the odd ambulance in trade for a quick walk to nearly anything retail that you would need. If you are looking to be treated wonderfully while sleeping in a beautiful space, this is where to stay! Thanks again, Avenue, for a wonderful vaca!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kearz10
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for a seminar, which was held at an older hotel and where I had originally booked. I had switched to stay at The Avenue and I'm so glad I did. I had a King room on the 22 floor. I didn't have a super view, but the room was a decent size, has a contemporary decor, has free WiFi, has an business center, and most importantly was clean and the bed comfy. All attributes of a hotel that works well for me. The hotel was located in the heart of the Magnificent Mile area. Almost a hop skip and jump are many of the stores enjoyed by many (Apple, Crate&Barrel, American Girl, Nordstrom, etc). Convenient to all. The only drawback I will mention is it's proximity to a hospital. Sirens were heard throughout the night - even from the 22 floor. The hotel does provide ironically enough ear plugs and an eye mask. I didn't end up using them, but there were times I woke up wishing I had. Overall, I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lake views great location”
Reviews.Author: definitiveaqua
Reviews.Content: Prime location in the middle of the magnificent mile the hotel has stunning floor to celiling windows that offer a stunning view of the lake that anyone would love to wake up to. The hotel has a bar on the upper floor which is nice and about average in price for the area. Personal favorite place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location, block off Michigan Avenue"”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room and very comfortable bed. Great location with excellent access to Michigan Avenue shops and restaurants. Front desk folks were very friendly and helpful. Restaurant next door- Elephant and Castle was convenient and food was good. Booked room on Priceline $125 a night- four stars. Negative, workout room eqt. old and room was quite warm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Conference Downtown”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Chicago for a conference. I stayed in this hotel 3 nights and really enjoyed my stay! I arrived early at 11 am but my room was not ready. So they kept my baggage and I went to eat lunch at Elephant and Castle pub next door. Great place. Good choices of beer and the fish and chips were great! Then did some shopping on Mag Mile. It is only 1 block from the hotel. So easy to get to. If you go up to Michagan and take a right and go 2 blocks there is a Walgreens. Good place to get water, pop, snacks, etc that you would want cheaper. Came back and got checked in early. Was upgraded to a corner suite. This is an awesome room and I would recommend to anyone. Has a sitting room with desk, TV and leather sofa. Then a nice bathroom and a big bedroom with views of Mich ave. I did not think the food was very good for the conference, but when I ordered room service 3 times it was very good, quick and hot. I did not get breakfast on the 40th floor, but went up and the view was great! My friends and I walked 15 min to Navy Pier. Very easy walk and fun time. There are some great restaurants along the way. I got a salad at The Corner Bakery and took to my room and it was great. If I had been here with my kids they would have been upset though as the pool is only outdoors so if not in the summer not an option. The pool did look great by pictures for the summer though. The service was great. The way I was checked in quickly and out and room service was nice. Also, they got me a cab very quickly going to the airport. It is about $40 cab ride from Midway airport. Yes, I heard ambulances at night a little, but was expecting that as right next door to a hospital. Can't exect anything else from a big city, so was ready for it. Did not keep my awake by any means. I would stay here again if on buisness or a girls weekend, but probably not with my kids if not in the summer. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1983Wales
Reviews.Content: The Avenue has a great location, just round the corner from the Magnificent Mile and 5 minutes walk from John Hancock centre. The staff were very helpful and pointed out all the places to go & recommended a great restaurant (Capital Grille) which they gave us a free appetizer voucher for when booking through them. Rooms were very spacious, nicely decorated and had all the mod cons - aircon, ipod dock, plasma screen etc. The breakfast was $18 so we chose to eat at the West Egg diner instead. A taxi to the airport was $40 and took approximately 30 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: CarlosERG
Reviews.Content: Chicago 1st timer. Went for Chicago Marathon weekend. Spent 6 nights at the Avenue. Really enjoyed staying there. Wanted a high floor room. They gave me a high floor room. Room 3706 is just 3 floors from the top. Two-room suite with a pull out bed, a kinda walk-in closet and king bed. They brought a crib up for my toddler within minutes of asking for one. Concierge services were very helpful and knowledgeable of good local spots, not necessarily the trendy but the good. Bell service was courteous and efficient. Got us cabs quickly and arranged an early morning van cab for all our stuff when leaving for the airport. Really had no problems with the Avenue. Elephant & Castle Bar and Restaurant on the lobby works up a nice meal and has a great selection of beer by the bottle and on tap. Try the club sandwich. But best of all...the hotel is kinda tucked away just off Michigan Avenue. Not too far north, not too far south. Just perfect, perfect location. Plenty to see and do close by within walking distance. Apple Store, Brooks Brothers, Niketown and a whole bunch of other stores along Michigan Ave. John Hancock Building and Water Tower just a few blocks away. It's an easy walk to downtown and the river, and a close walk to Lakeshore Drive and the lakefront. Adnd you can walk north to the Gold Coast neighborhood. Plenty to eat too close by. Visited West Egg Cafe and Volare Italian Restaurant. Coco Pazzo Cafe is also close by. The hotel definitely served as a home away from home. We could stop in for a quick clothes change, shower or an afternoon recharge, and it never felt out of the way. Plus it has a rooftop pool, which is very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, gorgeous view, very close to Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: tntpdx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct. 13&14 for a work function. Conference rate was $179 plus taxes. I lucked out and got upgraded to a corner suite on the 30th floor with a gorgeous and mostly unobstructed view of Lake Michigan. The suite has a separate living area with pullout couch, desk, flat screen TV, coffee maker and mini bar. There's a little hallway with the bathroom off to the side then the bedroom which had the most amazing180 degree view. Everything is clean and tidy, furnishings and linens, etc. were excellent. The hotel is one block off Michigan so very close to shops and restaurants. We walked everywhere we needed to go. The staff was very professional and speedy at check-in and housekeeping was prompt and thorough. We had a couple of meal events in the hotel and the food was fresh and tasty. There was some noticeable street noise at night, even this high up but the hotel provides a little kit with an eye mask, ear plugs and lavender spray which helped. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary get away!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila F
Reviews.Content: Hubby and i wanted to visit the city as we had never been. Our hotel room was wonderful and we got a suprise upgrade! Everyone in the hotel is very nice and the pub Elephant Castel was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ACanadianAbroad
Reviews.Content: Right off Michigan Avenue, 2 blocks south of Water Tower Place. Doesn't get much better than that if you want to shop the Magnificient Mile. It is also walking distance to Navy Pier and the Art Institute of Chicago. Plus, I like to take transit so there are lots of CTA buses on Michigan Ave. The rooms are comfy, modern and clean. I got a very good deal on the price so I wasn't expecting to be put in a junior suite. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. Room service prices were not bad but they tack on a flat fee of $3.00 (I think) plus a 20% gratuity which I found a bit outrageous. For the reviewers complaining about the noise, I was facing Huron street and yes, you hear city noises including ambulance sirens going to Northwestern hospital. It's a part of city life. It was no more noisy than my condo in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locality”
Reviews.Author: Karen1401_10
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a City Break in Chicago. The hotels location is minutes away from the Magnificent Mile and is central to everywhere in Chicago. The room and the facilities of the hotel were excellent and everywhere was clean and tidy. Only one little fault was that they do not supply you with Body wash/Shower gel.. so take your own! The Elephant and Castle pub which is located in the hotel serves excellent breakfasts at great value. Would definately recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Karin1951
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly for any outing. If you don't mind to walk a little it is close enough to everything that you can walk. Even the Hop On Hop Off is close by if you want a great way to see the city and decide where you want to go......Hotel staff was very helpful when ever I needed something. Room was clean and a very good size. Free Internet was great. Great for help when any information was needed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MOL8404
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Hotel and we were greeted with a big smile at the Reservation desk and were made to feel very welcome instantly (which was nice as it was 17:00pm on a Monday afternoon and we were both tired from our long trip from the UK but it helped give us a boost). We had also seen reviews of the hotel on various websites and had no hesitation on booking it and we were not disappointed. After explaining it was our first time in Chicago to celebrate our 9th Wedding Anniversary, it was an extremely generous and unexpected gesture when we were told we could have a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite. As I was already pleased with our original booking, nothing prepared us for this. All I can say is OMG, Unbelievable room. It really enhanced our stay further and we will always be grateful for that. The beds were so wide and comfortable and the Zebra chairs were amazing. It was also nice to see programs of your favourite American shows first before they come back to GB. Turn right out of the Hotel, walk for 30 seconds and you're on Mag Mile (Magnificent Mile) where all the Designer shops are and soo many places to eat. Also the hotel is great for for getting everywhere by walking due to its location. We found ourselves looking out the hotel window of the Crowne Plaza Avenue Hotel (32nd floor) just watching the views, excitement and the action of the city â€“ the lights etc. We had breakfast on the 40th floor which was also a very nice and filling and also good value for what was on offer. It also has views of the city and Lake Michigan (helps if a nice morning weather wise for the views). Another string to its bow is the fact that you don't need to leave the premises to go out for a drink as it's attached to a Pub on its ground floor (Genius). We found the staff very courteous and always willing to help when/if needed from House cleaning to Security to the Front Desk to Vern the Concierge. Thanks to ALL at the Avenue Crowne Plaza for a great memorable first time trip. We WILL be back but this time for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shimipor
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel. Enjoyed very much the location - close to everywhere in Chicago. The stuff - Very welcoming - ready to help. We were very satisfied - Recommending.....

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price...everything nice!”
Reviews.Author: flyncoastal
Reviews.Content: Chicago remains my favorite city of all time. I travel here for business quite a bit, but this trip brought both a change in pace and a traveling companion. My wife and I came to Chicago for a wedding being held at a local hotel. We decided to escape the crowd of wedding goers and save a few bucks and stay somewhere else close-by. Who would have known that we would land the Crown Plaza for such a great rate! We stayed 5 nights and were upgraded to a nice corner suite on the 22nd floor. The concierge welcomed us as we strode in at 11 p.m. absolutely exhausted from a long day of travel. He was very cordial and checked us in quickly. The upgraded room included a sitting room and wrap-around windows! The view was mostly high-rises, but looking east we could see the lake shore. Traveling without a computer, using the hotel's was easy to access and they were very nice with a choice between 2 macs or 2 pc's. The room was relatively clean, but the walls were a little thin...let your imagination run wild with this because you will probably be right with assuming what we heard. Needless to say it did not last too long and otherwise the hotel was quiet and pleasant. The location of The Avenue Hotel puts you within walking distance of everything that a typical tourist trip to Chicago encompasses. All in all, I give the hotel two thumbs up and recommend anyone discerning staying there to go with it (especially if you get a deal like we did!)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, you're better off at a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misterbeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference. They made multiple screw ups, some small and some big. Our first night we arrived exhausted with our small children in tow. We were pressured to hurry and unload even though there was no one else waiting behind us to get into the loading/unloading zone. I felt rather unwelcome, as that made getting settled quite stressful. We then got room service for dinner, and ordered a set of mini burgers for our toddler for dinner (kids menu). They arrived rare, which we did not ask for and is really dangerous for a kids' entree. I called to complain and they were actually gracious and gave us a fruit platter to compensate. This is the only time they made good on mistakes. Housekeeping walked into our room twice while we had the do not disturb sign up, once while our infant was asleep and the other time my husband was urinating. They never knocked. Their only parking option is valet, so we paid the $48/day for that. When we went to pick up the car, we saw that the door on my husband's brand new car had clearly been hit into a concrete wall, a big dent and scrape. The dash heads-up display that was glued on had been ripped off and stepped on and no longer works. Between these two things that was nearly $1000 damage to the car. We filled out a report but no one was apologetic, in fact they acted like it was not their problem. A small ding is one thing but this was a large dent and scrape. Not pleased at all. Even if I attend another conference here, I would stay at a different hotel and walk over. I've had better service at a comfort inn! For the price you'd think they would make more of an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cindywinnsboro
Reviews.Content: This hotel got mixed reviews so my sister and I were a little hesitant, but had some Priority Points toward 2 of our 3 nights and couldn't pass it up. The hotel was very nice. The location is just perfect! Shopping everywhere and the River was very close as well as the many restaurants. We got upgraded to a larger room which made it even better. We did not eat at the restaurant for breakfast as it seemed a little pricey. We did not have a problem with noise as some reviewers had said. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: hayden23911
Reviews.Content: Long weekend stay with the wife to do some shopping on the Mag Mile. Hotel is literally steps away from Michigan Ave, apple store, niketown, water tower and everything else....Location is amazing. You can also walk to the lake which is only a few blocks away as well. There is not much of a lobby area, but they do have a nice Pub at the hotel. Room was decorated nicely and was spacious....most importantly it was clean. Would defn' stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly awesome stay, with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: coasterlink
Reviews.Content: Overall, my three-night stay at The Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza was quite good, with no major complaints about the things that were most important to me. There were numerous quirky things though. I might call it the good, the bad and the weird. THE GOOD The location, just barely off North Michigan Avenue is in the real heart of things, especially for anyone visiting on leisure. Tons of great restaurants and shopping is all in walking distance. Other attractions and destinations are a longer but nice walk in pleasant weather, a short inexpensive cab ride way or accessibly by subway, the nearest station being just five short blocks away from the hotel. I wouldn't call the room spacious, but it's not cramped either. There's adequate room for two. The firm beds with pillow-top mattresses and very comfy linens provide a great night's sleep. Having a window that opens enough to allow a decent amount of fresh air in is also a great feature of the room. Giant kudos to this hotel for having free wireless Internet. Not only that, but the quality and connection is solid and doesn't even require having to continually sign on an agree to terms each day. I didn't have a single hiccup with it during my entire stay, which is a rarity for free or pay Internet access. The minibar is not only appropriately stocked with useful/common/popular items (instead of some of the strange things that some hotels offer), but the pricing on it is very fair. Housekeeping was prompt, thorough and very courteous. The staff was generally very helpful with requests and directions. THE BAD My one major complaint was the heating/air-conditioning unit, which was controlled by an electronic thermostat, but curiously located on a side interior wall, though it looked like a wall unit that would typically face outside. (Note that it was set at 65 when I arrived and it quickly became too cold, and I'm not a person who usually minds cooler air). Regardless of the setting, it seemed that the fan wanted to run nonstop. The temperatures during my September stay were moderate with cool nights and I felt like Goldilocks, because it seemed that it would either make the room too cold or too hot, but never just right. Turning the thermostat setting up just one degree, to 69 or 70 would cause it to start firing heat, which was completely unnecessary. Before the first night, I quickly learned that turning it off completely and opening the window for a while during the daytime made it perfect, not to mention quieter. I If this were brought to management's attention, they would probably say they would address it, but really, I think it's just a matter of the way the system is and not that it's malfunctioning. 'd be willing to bet that in hotter or colder months, the unit would do it's job better. Speaking of air-conditioning, even on chilly nights, the central air in the hallway was blasting cold air at full throttle from the vents in front of the elevators. Speaking of elevators, as others have pointed out, there's only three servicing 28 floors of rooms plus the lobby and two other floors. For the most part, it wasn't a big problem, but if you happen to catch an elevator rush hour when several people are checking in or a lot of people attending a convention are returning to their rooms at about the same time, it can get rather interesting with long waits from the room floors and a line in the lobby. THE SORT-OF BAD Soundproofing wasn't a strong point. Thankfully, I couldn't hear anything from my neighbors' rooms sans one toilet that flushed at least once every half hour all day and all night, but even on the high floors with the windows closed, the windows don't keep out the sounds of frequent sirens, horns and some other street noise. It didn't bother me in the least, but some light sleepers may be annoyed, While there was a newer desk lamp, newer duvets and and a newer flat screen television, most of the furniture was older including two lamps and the desk. I don't mind the mix of eras, but the desk, which was nice and large to work on, creaked when it got a little push. A new desk with some desk level electrical outlets would be a welcome addition. The bellman was plenty polite, but I have no idea why he offered to get me a cab every time I came down. Even when I asked for DIRECTIONS to a restaurant that was barely a 10 minute walk away (on a beautiful night, I might add), his response was "It's about a $5 cab ride. I'll get you a cab." I had to ask again, specifying and stressing that I was walking. Do the bellmen get a kickback from cabdrivers or what? THE WEIRD The cab-happy bellman could certainly fit into this category too. All of the front desk/guest services staff (it seems to be all one in lobby) were plenty nice and professional. Some were quick and confident in giving fairly simple directions and others had to pull out maps and/or ask someone (which sometimes led to asking someone else). They weren't beyond suggesting cabs either. When it came to accommodating a special request there were some inconsistencies -- one attendant gave an apologetic "no" without any checking while another was pleasant and more than happy to accommodate. The indoor pool and (outdoor) sundeck on the top floor seems like one of the hotel's treasures, and a secret treasure at that. The front desk staff never brought it up at check-in. On day 2 of my stay, I noticed it conservatively listed next to the 40th floor button on the elevator and checked it out. Another secret treasure is the breakfast (additional charge) available on the top floor, with a great view. Again, the front desk staff never mentioned it, but I noticed a very small sign for it somewhere in the hotel. The biggest unanswered question: Why are all glasses and cups stored at the furthest possible point from the sink? Seriously, both glasses and coffee cups were on a little table by the window at the far corner. They're almost hidden. Something should be rethought here. I've heard of water-saving shower-heads, but the fancy one in this room must hold the record -- at least for the minimal amount of water it puts out. I'm not sure that having to shower for twice as long ultimately saves anything. Personally, I'm of the opinion that they should save a little on energy with the nonstop AC and spend a little more on water. The fancy rod for the shower curtain, which curves out beyond the bathtub, requires users to really be sure to create good seal with the inner curtain. Amazingly, that meager amount of water can still flood the bathroom floor with the way the curtain is set up. I would have never guessed that I would ever notice that a room has too much artwork, but this one does. The room is still quite pleasant, but five wall-hangings in the modest size room is a bit much. Three of them are stunning black-and-white nicely framed large photos of the Chicago skyline and various Chicago landmarks. One of the three is partially masked by an old lamp that sits in front of it (photo provided). The two that seem out of place are panoramic color photos of the Chicago skyline that hang at a high level above each of two beds, above the already high good-looking headboards of the beds. Even more odd is that the two pictures are exactly identical. Someone astonishing is that in my room one of them was not centered with the bed -- and it was off by a sizable amount (picture provided).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: rosamund_bone
Reviews.Content: If this is your 1st time to Chicago, then you can't go wrong with this hotel. Location is fantastic, just off the Magnificent Mile (and opposite Tiffany). If you're looking for a romantic break, then maybe this isn't the hotel for you. However, if you're looking for somewhere to crash, it's an ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belly760
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza was a very convenient and nice hotel. Extremely reasonably priced for Chicago and best of all FREE wireless Internet in the rooms. Parking is expensive and that is pretty much the only downside. If you can manage without a car, go that route as public transportation is good and also the hotel is just off the Magnificent Mile and easily walkable to all attractions. Hotel also has a 'British (?)' Pub downstairs and we ate there on 2 occasions and foor was good and reasonable. Pool is on the 40th floo with a great view. Rooms are of good size, usual amenities, clean and nothing out of the ordinary but still very fine. Staff at the hotel were accomodating, free USA Today in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at an Expensive location”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Check-in/out Staff at front desk were efficient. Room/Facility/Lobby For the price, they've done a decent job with the upkeep of this older property. Nothing that would WOW a traveler, but just a very comfortable stay. There's no in-room safe, which I believe they should really invest in adding to the rooms. Most travelers nowadays carry iPads, iPods, etc and we need a safe place to store our goodies. WIFI Free WIFI service throughout the hotel and in the rooms. I love that they're not nickel and diming this service like other major hotels. Room: 1901 Best to avoid all the "XX01" rooms as they're all located next to the staff service entrance. Every morning at 8 am sharp, the service door next to my door would start to slam as the staff go about their day. A rude awakening for sure. Pool A small roof top pool is available with a beautiful view of Lake Michigan. Restaurants I had breakfast at both the Sky Lounge and the British Pub down stairs. You go to the Sky Lounge for the breathtaking view of the lake (the buffet breakfast food was quite bad). May be better to go for a cup of tea or cocktail at night. The British Pub restaurant downstairs has great service and good quality food. TAXI/Train to AIRPORT USD$8 for taxi to Clark/Lake Blue Line CTA station + $2.50 for CTA train to O'hare Airport. USD$40 for taxi to O'hare Airport. Final Thought Can't beat the value for Michigan avenue adjacent. Clean comfortable and affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: annakoz21
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Avenue Hotel, Crowne Plaza in downtown Chicago and loved it! It was very convenient to all attractions and the room was clean and spacious, perfect for what we needed. There was a rooftop pool that was open to all guests offering a beautiful FREE view of Chicago! We recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel in Chicago as an affordable, clean hotel in a great centralized location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, room and location”
Reviews.Author: mwlinabq
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. From start to finish, our trip was perfect. The concierge was fantastic (and saved us a long wait for a nearby pizza place). The one-bedroom suite was really nice since we were traveling with a toddler. The room was laid out a little strange because it was on a corner, but it was nice to have the extra room where she could sleep uninterrupted. When I asked about a fridge at check-in because we needed to keep her milk cold, they waived the $20 fee. I was really surprised and grateful for that because we were traveling on a budget (got the room using airline miles). The location is perfect. You're a block off Michigan Avenue and it's a short walk to get to great stores and restaurants. We'd totally stay again! My only complaint is that the elevators are ridiculously small and slow. There were several times we waited five to ten minutes to get one that had enough room to accommodate us and the stroller.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Tootles512
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Avenue Crown Plaza for 5 nights. The hotel is half block off the Magnificent Mile and across the street from Northwestern Medical Center. We walked to Millennium Park and Oats Beach. Our King room was large with ample blankets. The bathroom was clean and spacious. We had a Wonderful room with a view of Michigan Ave. The professional staff greeted us by name each time we passed through the lobby. The valet staff was courteous and quick with a compliment. The workout room is small but adequate. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kytraveler2913
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite (Priority Club Members). The bed was so comfortable. Views were great. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “JUST AN AVERAGE CROWN PLAZA WHICH IS DIRECTLY OPPOSITE A MAJOR BUSY HOSPITAL SO EXPECT AMBULANCE SIRENS DURING THE NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Taxi from the airport to hotel approximately US$45. Priority Club members will have the normal recognition. Only two check in counters so check in is a little slow. SECURITY: Anyone can walk into the hotel lobby and take the lift to any floor without the use of a key card - there is no security. No security camers on any of the floor corridors so secutity is very poor. There are no in room safes at this hotel and you need to apply for a security box at the front desk. This is inconvenient as you have to go to the reception to gain access to your security box. ROOMS: Windows are not double glazed. The hotel is directly opposite a major hospital so there are sirens going all night so donâ€™t expect to get much sleep. It will make no difference how high your floor is as the noise will be the same - even on the 40th floor. Tip - use the ear plugs provided in the comfort pack and turn the airconditioning to the manual fan position so it will be on constantlly and help to drown out the siren noise. Bathrooms in the suites are very small and cramped so no room for toiletries on the side of the basin. Instead of being the â€˜Windy Cityâ€™ it should be called â€˜The Siren Cityâ€™ because of the interminable sound of sirens all night. DRINKING WATER: No bottled water in your room so you need to purchase it from the Mini Bar. If you exit the hotel, turn right and take the next right into Michigan Ave you will find a Supermarket on the corner about 2 blocks up - most items available including water and Australian wine 750ml bottel for US$6. INTERNET: Very slow and drops out all the time so not very convenient. Also problems with not being able to send e-mails so had to open up a Gmail account to send any e-mails out. Definitely the worst internet connection I have ever experienced in any hotel ever. BREAKFAST: Sky lounge breakfast ok. Consists of scrambled eggs (made from powdered milk so not very good), bacon, saussages and potatoes. Good selection of fruit etc. and rolls (some not so fresh though as they appear to be a few days old). Tables in the Sky Lounge are the smallest I have ever encountered - just enough room for 2 plates and 2 cups of coffee. Very cramped. Breakfast also available at the Elephant and Crown which is the on site restaurant. We had dinner there one night but not good so would not recommend it for a meal at night. CLUB FLOOR: There is no club floor at this hotel. There is a Sky Lounge which is open for continental type breakfast only though. REFRIGERATOR: Read the fridge instructions very carefully because if you move anything the sensor will detect it and charge it directly to your room. It is not possible to place any of your own drinks, medications or other items in this fridge. You can have an additional fridge placed in your room for a cost of US$20 for the entire stay. POSITION: Good location and the Magnificent Mile is in the next street. (Michigan Ave). Navy Pier is an area where there are many restaurants and about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. Boat tours are also available from the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but generally ok”
Reviews.Author: PSprakes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 US hotels in 10 days, and it has to be said that this was comfortably the poorest. Poor is unfair, but we agreed it was distinctly average. Checked in ok. Room was a decent size, but as others have reported, the bathroom was very small. If they'd have extended the bathroom into the biggest ironing board cupboard I've ever seen, it would have been a decent size. It was hot in Chicago this week, so the air conditioning was a necessity. Well it certainly worked ok, but was possibly propelled by two jet engines. Others had reported this, but crikey, what a noise! Turned it off and sweated it out, otherwise a good nights sleep would not Â have been possible. The bed was huge and comfortable. The TV was a good size also. The room in general was fine, just a little tired, as were the corridors. Our room was 3201, bang next to the housekeeping store, and we were woken up early by the maids on both mornings. I would recommend putting your 'privacy' sign up regardless, otherwise the maid will join you automatically early doors. The gym was empty, had it to myself; fine, but again a little tired. The rooftop pool, was nice, but a little tired. Free wireless and use of the business centre was great. Allowed us to log on and print boarding tickets etc. Biggest annoyance was that the guy who checked me in said changing my travellers cheques the following day would be no problem at all. So I didn't panic and find an exchange facility elsewhere. Sure enough, when asking his colleague (he wasn't on shift) the following morning it was like I'd asked to have the President to bring me room service. A definite no go, which left me panicking that morning and rushing around to get cash so that I wasn't late for an appointment. Staff in general were friendly, but some evidently mis-informed. This was the only place not to acknowledge we were on honeymoon throughout the stay in the US. Of course, no given right to this, but a nice touch from others in various ways. 3rd out of 3 during the honeymoon. Ok, but nothing special, would try elsewhere if there's a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs updated”
Reviews.Author: Kim2563
Reviews.Content: I came here for a 3 day conference also being held in the hotel. The location was fabulous, and there were a lot of great places to eat within a few blocks. My room was comfortable and roomy, and the price was reasonable. My only complaints are that this hotel is in serious need of some updating. There are only 3 elevators and they are painstakingly slow. It was not unusual to have to wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator, and by that time there was such a large crowd waiting that I often had to wait for a second elevator. I had no desire to walk up 25 flights of stairs either. The plumbing is very old, and very LOUD in your room. I heard noise every time my neighbors flushed, showered, etc. The ice machine was a few doors down from me and sounded like someone was pounding on the wall with a hammer each time it was used. The meeting room left a lot to be desired, but that probably wouldn't be an issue for most people staying here. I'd probably look elsewhere for my next Chicago stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a quick night in the city!!”
Reviews.Author: laurabell
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our favorite city!! We did a quick last minute weekend get away. We booked via priceline name your own price. This was a perfect location for us just one easy block off of Michigan Ave. Just around the corner from Northwestern. We had a wondeful stay very clean and comfortable. Probably the best nights sleep one can get in a noisy busy city. I felt like I was in the clouds sleeping so comfortable. My husband had to drag me out bed this morning. Would not hesitate to stay here again. (should note via priceline name your own price we selected the area and star level and than priceline chooses the hotel.) We are extremely familar with the city lay out so we kinda knew which choices they could be. Worked great for us and as always we had a blast. Lots of walking and gorgeous sites to see! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Crown just off the Michigan Mile”
Reviews.Author: Jewelwatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a weekend get-away and all our favorite hotels were booked or too pricey for the weekend due to the Air and Water Show so we ended up at the Avenue Hotel Crown Plaza. It was actually quite nice and we may consider staying again in the future. Upon check-in with the super friendly staff, we were upgraded to a room with a complimentary MAC desktop. Imagine that!?!? Not only do you get free Wi-Fi at this hotel but a huge desktop computer to use. Don't try to stream anything - it has it's limits. But it was nice when due to rain we wanted to find something else to do in the city and could easily look it up on the MAC. Our room was large and well-appointed. The King bed was deliciously soft and the lighting adequate for reading before bed. The bathroom was a wee bit small especially when trying to get ready for an outing at the same time as my husband. When I tried to put some soda in the refrigerator I noted the dire warning that if I put any personal items in the mini-bar, I would be charged a $25 restocking fee. Yikes! They suggest asking for an additional refrigerator for the room which I'm quite sure you would have to pay for. Fortunately, they provide a large ice bucket and a couple cans of soda stay adequately cold in that. Housekeeping must be a bit over-worked as they did not get to our room until later in the afternoon. We also discovered a cashew left by a previous guest next to the chair which means they don't vacuum quite as thoroughly as one would hope. I can live with an errant cashew. The air conditioning unit was a whole other problem. When we arrived, the room was absolutely frigid and the AC was set at 65. We turned it to a more palatable 72 and the heat came on. We turned it back a bit to 68 and were soon back at the North Pole. Turning it to 70 resulted in the heat coming back on. After an hour of experimenting, we were finally able to get a fairly comfortable temperature at 73 (go figure) but didn't dare try to change it after that in fear that we would be frozen or parboiled. We probably should have mentioned it but previous experience with similar problems at a hotel resulted in too much hassle to make complaining worth it and we did after much experimenting, end up fairly comfortable. Avenue - if you are reading this - the AC problem was in room 3301. Also, the air conditioning unit is louder than many of the planes we saw at the Air and Water Show. But it helped to drown out the frequent ambulance sirens. The hotel also thoughtfully provides a set of ear-plugs. One wonders if they are to drown out the sirens or the air conditioning unit?!?!? On to other things... There is a roof top pool with a terrific view - the pool area is rather small and when we went to check it out, the eight or ten people up there made the area quite crowded so we crossed that activity off our list. The hotel also offers a breakfast buffet which at the time of this review was $17 per person. After reading some other reviews and considering the price, we decided to enjoy breakfast elsewhere. There's lots of great choices in the area for a lot less money. Parking is priced at $48 per night just so you know. Having lived in the Chicago area for years we know that just a couple of blocks off of Michigan Avenue to the west is a plethora of less expensive parking buildings and lots if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks. The location of the hotel is great - just a short block off of Michigan Avenue. We walked over to the Chicago River to have dinner at a restaurant just off of LaSalle. We did a lot of shopping just a couple blocks away at Water Tower Place. We enjoyed a concert at Millenium Park and we walked up to North Avenue Beach for the Air and Water Show. Cabs are easy to come by and the subway and buses are all close-by if you do not enjoy walking. Will I stay at the Avenue again - I just might. The location, the view from our room, the comfy bed, the wonderful staff all make returning a possibility. The noisy persnickety air conditioning makes returning a wee bit less of a possibility. We shall see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stacy021020
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location. Friendly staff. Pool on top floor with gorgeous view. Clean. Comfortable bed. Cons: Parking is $48/night. Slow elevators. Small pool. Fridge did not work. Our room was on 35th floor with great view. Out the door is Michigan Ave. Gino's is around block, M Burger across the street. Navy Pier is about one mile. We took bus 151 (Sheridan) to Old Town for dinner, Second City show, Lincoln Park/Zoo and more shopping. A number of restaurants in Old Town. Mexican restaurant next door to Second City has the best margaritas and guacamole, I have ever tasted. Fudge Pot had delicious chocolate and Pecan Turtles that everyone should try.

Reviews.Title: “the usual”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl13canada
Reviews.Content: we came during 'Lolapolusa' so all of the rooms were booked up fast so instead of getting 2 double beds we had to get a king suite with a pull out couch. We thought that since the hotel was "Good" & "well respected" we thought that the pull out couch would not be bad..but when we pulled it out and layed on it, you could feel each and every spring coil on your back, because the bed was worn down to a thin peice of "padding" and was very uncomfortable. we told the front desk and they gave us a complimentary roll bed, it was better but not great. In addition the staff was very helpful and the pool on the 40th floor was very nice, a bit windy but very nice view! Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BUTTERS84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights on business. Nice hotel with friendly staff (Romeo, who helped me out was very professional). I stayed in one of the suite's that were nice and spacious but a bit dark and dim. Breakfast was very nice served on the top floor with great views. The English pub attached to the hotel was great and did really feel like an English pub from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jeffv216
Reviews.Content: I stayed here early Augsut 2011 for 5 nights. The location is very good, its not right on top of the subway or train, but the walk is not too bad to the Chicago St. Red Line Stop. Also, the hotel is right off Michigan Avenue, so you will have plenty of shopping options to keep you occupied. Great food isn't far away either. I easily walked to Grant Park, but it is a bit of a walk for those who don't want to do it on foot. We caught a cab back from right at Millenium Park after dinner for about $8-9. The rooms were very large and the bed was comfortable. I think the bathroom could be larger and the rooms a bit smaller, but they were fine. Good for business or pleasure trips. Service was great and everyone on staf was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: DenbighshireSoulie
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, clean hotel, breakfast great, pool clean.
