However, before booking ensure you ask for a room with air conditioning that is not connected to the adjoining room, and away from the ice machine. The first five nights were great as the ice machine was out of order, as soon as it was repaired guests stood outisde our room chatting whilst getting their ice up til after midnight. We requested a room change and then after returning from a night out we turned the air conditioning off in our room but it sounded as if it hadn't turned itself off. We called the engineer and he explained that it was an old system and it was the room next door that obviously kept their air conditioning on all night - it was like sleeping in a jet engine. We asked for a change of room but each one my husband was shown was the just the same. We spent the night on the duvet in the quietest corner of the room by the bathroom and the room door. Fancy paying for a room and camping out on the floor!!! We were moved to a suite the next day, it was great until ........both adjoining rooms kept their air conditioning on all night - imagine what that was like!!! we didn't say anything that night as it was our last. Staff were apologetic but obviously the air conditioning system needs updating and signs need to be placed asking guests to refrain from using the ice maching after a certain until a suitable time in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago - Stay”
Reviews.Author: PRunion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crown Plaza for two days. The location was great, right off of Michigan Street, close to everything. The room was great, the service was great. The only advice I can give is to make sure you read the note on the refrigerator, if you store your own food in it you will be charged a $25.00 fee..

Reviews.Title: “The Best Yet!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandtravel2
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Chicago, and the best yet. We stayed in a one bedroom corner suite at the Avenue Crowne Plaza just off Michigan Avenue. The room was spectacular, bigger and better than in the photographs and immaculately clean. The bathroom had a rain shower and was a good size. There is no in-room fridge, which was a bit inconvenient as we had to keep our beer cool by putting it into the ice bucket. You could rent a fridge for $20.00, but we didn't bother as this was only a minor detail. However, I would recommend that the hotel reconsider putting a fridge in each room as this would indeed upgrade the already excellent focus on the customer needs. The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant, but is adjacent to the Elephant and Castle Pub, where we had an excellent breakfast for around $8.00 each. The hotel does have a breakfast buffet available in the sky lounge on the 40th floor, but we do not recommend it - it was very pricey and the breakfast was not the greatest. So unless you want to go up for the view - which you can see from the outdoor pool area, we would suggest you skip the hotel breakfast ($40.00 for two) and head downtown to the many excellent and economical breakfast joints that surround the hotel. We would also recommend you park in one of the self-park lots, or train it in, as the parking at the hotel was $48.00/night. But don't let these details put you off staying at the Avenue - the room was superb, roomy, clean, and had an excellent view of the city and partial view of the lake from our floor to ceiling corner windows on the 31st floor. We certainly recommend this hotel, the staff were pleasant and helpful and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chitowngirl45
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights - hotel is a perfect location, for shopping, dining etc. All the staff were freindly and helpful...I think the rooms/suites can use an update,(tiny bathrooms) but all in all I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: danderism
Reviews.Content: from the moment you check in to after check out the staff will tend to your every need. Every employee has a warm sincere greeting. We left something in the room after checkout, and they went above and beyond to help me find the item. Other hotels can learn from the,

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stay, prime location, check out buffet with views”
Reviews.Author: tripholic
Reviews.Content: Nice stay-highly recommend! Great service-got a late checkout to sightsee-No problem. Clean room and bathroom. Had an IMAC in room!! Nice pool and buffet was well worth the $19.00 if you are hungry, I had a 20% coupon upon check in. AAA rate was under $260.00.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALTravellor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, the location excellent. Staff is helpful. The price is high $200 plus a night and parking at the hotel is a budget killer at $45 per night - both are ludicrous. Due to costs you may want to research other options which are plentiful within a 3 block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TandJ_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend, and wanted to be close to a little shopping, bars/restaurants of Rush, and walking distance to the subway. The Avenue was a solid hotel that fit our requirements. The staff was friendly and heplful, and even provided a pass to cut the line at Gino's East. The lobby and rooms were nicely done, about what I expect from Crowne Plazas when I stay there. There is also a nice rooftop pool on the 40th floor with views of Lake Michigan, and a little British Pub attached to the lobby (didn't eat there, only had a couple drinks). The hotel entrance is just off Michigan Ave, which I liked. You are close to the action, but don't have to walk out the front door into the throngs of people. All in all, they deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ak8973
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel. Very clean, roomy, nice and helpful staff, great location for shopping. I asked for a room high up and with a great view and that is exactly what I got! I left the "do not disturb" sign on the door because I didn't need any more towels, and housekeeping called to say they didn't come because of the sign, but if I needed anything to just let them know. I thought that was very nice. Also, they even supplied ear plugs because of the noisy streets below, which I thought was pretty cool. Overnight parking was ridiculous, but I guess that is what you get when you come to the city. I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent located downtown - we would like to go back”
Reviews.Author: carstoiuc
Reviews.Content: I stayed there together with my wife for 7 nights. Excellent location on Michican Avenue in Chicago, located 5-10 minutes to one of the best locations for Stuffed Pizza (Chicago Speciality), not mentioning the iconic buildings in Chicago. Breakfast was minimal though, not exactly what we were expecting if you serve buffet. Very limited choice, although the bar is on the rooftop of a very tall building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Affordable price, Comfortable Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Anelle4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls weekend. I would definitely stay here again. Pros: The rooms were reasonably priced, very clean and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on! It was also very quiet we never heard noise from other rooms. The location was perfect. We walked to all the sites we were interested in seeing, The Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, Hancock Tower, and Lake Michigan. The concierge were very helpful with directions and answering questions about sites to see. Cons: The hotel elevators tended to be slow during peak hours (during check out time, dinner time, breakfast time). The roof top pool was nice but quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Location”
Reviews.Author: ckstar16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza two nights for a business conference. The hotel has a prime location, close to the Magnificent Mile, Ginoâ€™s East and Navy Pier, which allowed me to get a good feel of downtown Chicago during my limited free time. My room was very spacious, clean and comfortable, and the conference facilities were adequate for my group. I greatly appreciated the free wifi. Things to note: 1) The elevators are slow. I was forced to take the stairs at one point, and the empty, cement area was a little unnerving. 2) The food at our conference was terrible. I had colleagues choosing to skip lunch rather than eat the prepared meal. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again since it offered a good value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location&service/noisy heating”
Reviews.Author: aeromosa
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to the Magnificient Mile; Apple store right at the corner:), shops and coffee shops nearby. Very nice staff who gave us the appartment on almost top floor instead of standard dbl room that we had booked just because we stayed 6 nights. The only negative was the heating that was pretty noisy and little bit annoying.. If they fix this somehow, I can only reccommend for both bsns & leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, nothing too exciting.....”
Reviews.Author: rfogsndego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family trip, had several rooms. The hotel has been nicely renovated, nothing too exciting but clean, friendly service and the pub is a nice palce to have a drink. We had a room wiht a Mac ont he desk for our use, kids loved having it available. One block from Gino's East, so your deep dish is around the corner. Easy walking distance to most places and adequate fitness center. Our rate was ~$185 per night....

Reviews.Title: “Above average ... for a Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelGeek
Reviews.Content: Writing this review is a bit tricky, given the old saying about gifted horses, and for a free stay I won in a competition it was actually a great place to stay in. The location is fantastic, just off Michigan Avenue, perfect if you want to go shopping. The upper floors have a great city or lake view, and the corner suite we stayed in was very spacious. The room was well looked after, apart from maybe needing a lick of paint, the obnly thing that I really did not like (and this is a personal thing) were the pooh-brown net curtains which took out a lot of the light that the huge windows allowed to come in. We had to open the net curtains, which in turn meant less privacy, the high-risers opposite probably got a good view of the room from across the street. It appears to be an airline crew hotel, normally a good gauge that it is a decent place, and it has everything it needs to make a stay comfortable and restful, it is just not standing out from the rest. I would not have chosen the hotel, but was very happy with it throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: GalleyBayBride
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over memorial weekend. Check in was quick and easy, we were on the 36 floor. Had fantastic views of the lake and other buildings. The room was big and clean, the bathroom was clean and a reasonable size too, shower was good. Bed was comfy and we slept well. Didn't hear much noise from the hospital which we were worried about after reading reviews here. Was pleased with the free Wifi we used this whilst at the hotel. The location was excellent, everything was within walking distance. We ate breakfast here and it was nice, a little steep in price but that is to be expected. Staff were friendly and helpful, my only qualm would be that I emailed a week before our arrival and never got a reply or acknowledgement which was a bit disappointing. All in all a good stay, and we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for Your Buck!!!”
Reviews.Author: MomaMac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary, this was our first time in Chicago. This hotel is clean, bed was really comfortable. The staff are really friendly. We had a king room, with Imac computer (free wifi) for a great price, but we booked well in advance of arrival. It really is the best location to all you need to see in the city. My only thing is the valet parking is a little steep at $48/24 hour stay, but I assume that is the going rate for parking in the city. Definitely would stay here again, if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay and still impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ketchtwenty2
Reviews.Content: I checked in at the Avenue for a business trip last week. This is my second stay at this hotel. I have stayed at nearly all of the IHC group hotels in downtown Chicago, including the Intercontinental. This hotel is clearly my favorite. The location is great. I finally got to eat at the restaurant (Elephant & Castle) attached to the hotel and it was pretty good, for English pub food. The hotel is also right around the corner from Gino's East pizza if you want Chicago-style pizza when you are there. I was upgraded to a suite again on this trip....the exact same suite I was in last time...coincidence? The room was very large, with a comfortable bed and a great living room. Great service. Great sleep experience. The clips on the blackout curtains are a convenient amenity. I will be back. Is room 2815 in my future??

Reviews.Title: “Great product; value, location and style in one”
Reviews.Author: joe_cool_joe82
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Chicago and I opted to stay in the Crowne Plaza Downtown primarily due to price for one night before heading out to a Chicago Suburb. I was very pleased with the quality for the price and this is definitely at the top end of the Crowne Plaza value proposition. It is situated right off North Michigan Ave on the street between the Apple and Nine West Stores. The rate was booked direct with the Crowne Plaza website, with a better rate thru finding it with Kayak (which then linked me to Crowne Plaza). I didn't have time to eat in the restaurants or breakfast, although there is a Corner Bakery Cafe (one of my Chicago favourites) just a block away. Please note I felt let down by the door staff who told me it would be the same to call a suburb taxi (I quoted a rate) as use a Chicago taxi; it ended up costing an extra 40%....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SliderNC
Reviews.Content: My fiance and her family stayed at The Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza for Easter weekend. We had two rooms, one was a double queen bed room and the other was a king suite. Both rooms were booked online via Priceline and we saved about 60% off the current rates at the time, which went up even more as the holiday approached. Over, we enjoyed the hotel. We were in town to visit family and found the location of this hotel to be just perfect for walking to a host of areas in and around downtown. The staff at the front desk and the doormen were great and always quick to help you out with directions, taxis or anything you could possibly need. The king room was nice with a huge leather couch and arm chair in the living room. The bedroom had a plush king bed with updated bedding and had some nice views of downtown and the lake. Bathroom was a little bit small, but nothing that we couldn't handle. The rain showerhead was a nice touch as well. The room was pretty well updated with one LCD TV, a cordless phone (first one I had seen in a hotel), and some nice furniture. The double queen room was much smaller than the king suite, however, it was normal and matched what you would find in most standard hotels. Updated bedding, LCD TV, a nice comfy chair and updated bathroom as well here. Being on an upper floor, the view was much better. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and would probably stay here for a weekend again, even if it were at the normal rates as they are actually pretty reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “WHat a great Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: I want to start this review with the staff. I would say that the staff at this Crowne were by far some of the best that I have ever dealt with. A special thanks to Jenna and Sara. Every member of this hotels staff were more than helpful and friendly throughout our entire stay. This is a perfect location if you plan to shop on Michigan Avenue. It is also close enough to Rush Street if you are here to party. A great base station if you plan to hit the Pier or the museums. We were put on the 36th floor which is their quiet floor. I will request this floor from now on. They do not allow people with small children or large groups of people to be on this floor. We loved it. The room was very spacious with a great view. We could see Lake Michigan and Michigan Avenue. The beds were extremly comfortable including the pillows. I would have liked to have had a fridge rather then the mini bar, but you can't have it all. This was a great trip at a great hotel. We will be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Sometimes a Bit Loud”
Reviews.Author: johnmOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the March Break while we explored Chicago. The location of the hotel is great as its right in the middle of the magnificent mile that is Michigan Avenue. There is lots of shopping around as well as good resturants. Transit was close by including the subway's red line as well as bus routes that go to navy pier and the musuem campus for the aquirium and the Field's Museum. The Hotel itself is nice and seems to have been kept up well. As a an elite member of the priority club points program we got an upgraded room that was both spacious and clean. There is a wonderful bakery on the corner around from the hotel that is both good and fast for breakfast in the morning as well as lunch. My only compliant is that the hotel can be very loud at night. It is close to a hospital and a fire hall and as a result, there is a fairly constant sound of sirens. For some reason Chicago sirens seem so much louder than those that I have experienced anywhere else either in the US or Canada. I would recomend the hotel but if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Hhunterr
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for spring break with my wife, son, son's friend and niece. We pick the Avenue Crowne Plaza for it's location. It's 1 block off Michigan Ave., 2 blocks from the Water Tower and about 6 blocks from the river. Everything is an easy walk with the real bonus for me being it's across the street from the Apple Store (I picked up the new IPAD2). If you want to be in the heart of Michigan Ave, then you can't beat it for the price! It was $125+ Tax, with parking running $49. Being a priority club member I got to check in early and check out late (2pm on both). We had 2 rooms (boys and girls) and had requested them be side by side adjoining, but got them across the hall from each other. Worked out well. The hotel was very quite for being right next to a hospital with ambulances coming in all night. We never heard them until we went outside. The staff at the front desk were really great. The doorman got us a great car and driver to take us to & from the Blue Man Group. Very inexpensive compared to a taxi. Only thing bad about the rooms were the bathrooms were very small, otherwise clean, quite and comfortable like you expect from a Crowne Plaza. We did eat on the 40th floor at their SkyView Lounge for breakfast. A small, but good buffet. Again the staff was GREAT! Only complaint I had about it was the seating, there is just not enough of it. The lounge is suppose to be for priority club members but others were coming in for it so some of us ended at the bar while others sat a small table. Overall an excellent place that I would stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars, You Kidding?”
Reviews.Author: todavis
Reviews.Content: What does it take to get a 4 star rating? Not much here. Staff was friendly, bell hop was rude. The door to the bathroom the paint was peeling. The room was very small and old looking. BUT,the view was AWESOME and was the only thing 4 stars. I've stayed at Comfort and Sleep Inns that were nicer. This isn't what I consider a 4 star hotel. If you park at the hotel, it will cost you $48.00 per day. We parked at O'Hare Airport in the $9.00 parking lot and took the L-train to the hotel. It was my first time riding the L-train and it was a great experience and tons of fun. It takes about and hour to go from the airport to the hotel on the train. We stayed on the 28 floor and you could hear every siren from every emergency vehicle that was going downtown. That was a shock. Don't expect to get a quiets night sleep. Too much money to stay here. No benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Action & the Noise”
Reviews.Author: ellzebeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and have lots of compliments paired with one big complaint. The hotel staff were always helpful and friendly, made us feel welcome. The housekeeping staff was attentive, beyond my expectations. We requested some extra items in the bathroom, and not only did we find they had stocked it up for us, we later received a phone call from Housekeeping to make sure what they left was sufficient. That was a first, and much appreciated! The hotel sits almost right off Michigan Avenue, close to the shopping and lots of eateries, and a short walk from the River. The rooms were well appointed, though maybe a touch small (Double Queen Room). The only real downside was the sound of the emergency vehicles. We heard them during the day, which didn't bother us, but also during the night, making it difficult to sleep. Perhaps because we were on a high floor, the noise seemed louder as it echoed between the buildings...the sirems were definitely louder than we've ever experienced before, and it woke us 3 to 4 times per night into the early morning...makes for unrestful sleep. This of course is not a 'fault' of the hotel, but if you want to relax and sleep in, forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a girls night!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTea
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I hit the road - we wanted to escape from home and visit Chicago! By pure chance we booked our stay here the day of our stay through a referral service - and we were in awe! It was my friends first time in Chicago and my 6th time. the location is AMAZING - within walking distance of major attractions and shopping! If you cant walk there you can get on the bus or train and get to it! Outstanding service, friendly treatment, clean rooms with a GREAT view! We lucked out and got a room on the corner and fell asleep with the curtain open enjoying the view of downtown Chicago. I would recommend this place to everyone I know! There is a pool on the rooftop that is open based on the season. There is a restaurant on the ground and top floors as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: MiniCoopMI
Reviews.Content: After staying in quite a few Chicago hotels, we have found a favorite in the Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza. The price (from Priceline) for a weekend in Feb was comparable to a much lesser star hotel. The hotel offers free wi-fi and free workout facilities as well as clean, comfortable rooms. We were even lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite- at no extra charge! The beds are soft and comfortable and the rooms have great views from very large windows. We enjoyed waking up to views of the new Trump building. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of counter space. The location could not have been better for a Chicago weekend of shopping and eating. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superior rooms”
Reviews.Author: adamhutchy
Reviews.Content: Great Loaction and helpful staff after initial snag of not finding my reservation due to mix up with BA. Excellent rooms to make up for the blip though. Perfect for shopping and base for sight seeing no taxi more than $12 to be fair perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: AliDUk
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for it's location and service. As many have said, it is right in the middle of the city, close to the shops and many tourist attractions. The staff were very welcoming, but not over the top! We used our oints which made our stay great value. Our room on the 38th floor was large with great views of the city. The only thing negative I could say was the water pressure in the shower could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Tiff096
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Avenue Hotel for three nights. We arrived at the hotel around 10am due to an early flight. Although we requested early check-in, we were not assigned a room until 2:30pm. However, the hotel staff was very accomodating. They held all of our luggage which allowed us to go out and have breakfast at a restaurant recommended by the hotel concierge. It also gave me an excuse to do some shopping. The hotel is conveniently located right off Michigan Ave. The bed was very comfortable. We stayed in a suite which was ok but the living room area seemed as though it was lacking decor and matching furniture pieces. The only bad experience I had was with the temperature control in our room. It was very cold outside and it seemed as if the thermostat had a mind of its own. When we wanted it to blow out heat it blew out cold air. I think this has contributed to my cold. Overall I would definitely say this was a nice hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: larslentz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our visit to Chicago and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the rooms. Rooms were all updated with great views of the city from the upper floors. There is a pool on the roof level also. Overall a friendly staff and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “A few yard from the Magnificient Mile. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: Caximba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza The Ave for 3 days during the February storm. Its pretty close to Michigan Av, very well located. The internet acess worked well. In the lobby there's a acess to the Elephant & Castle Pub, nice food and beer :) Its preety close to Apple store and Gino's Pizzeria. The staff was very friendly during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: LennyG
Reviews.Content: A great hotel at a great rate in pretty much the best possible location in Chicago. As others have said, the rooms are modern with many amenities and very comfortable beds. My night's stay was very quite (although it was a weeknight). My room had great views of downtown. There is free wifi and valet parking is something like $48 (but this is normal for the area). It was essentially a perfect night. My one complaint is that the staff tried too hard to get me to use their services (i.e., I really don't need them to call a cab for me, but the person at the front door wouldn't leave me alone).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: DanDLT
Reviews.Content: We read prior reviews before staying here, especially noting the negatives. Many past issues have been resolved. There is now an electric outlet at the desk that can service four customer items (in addition to the tv, lamps, etc). There are no pay-per-view movies, but the cable selection is very extensive (better than most - at least 60 channels), plus one Showtime channel. We weren't near the ice machine, but I could see where other tripadvisor reviewers could have that issue if their room were right next to the machine. Internet access is free and is both wired and wireless. Plus the business center is free, even for printing. This was convenient for both maps and boarding passes. There are 2 macs and 2 pcs, so waiting was never an issue. Desk staff and housekeeping staff were all polite, helpful and prompt. As an example, we didn't have a car, but were incorrectly charged for parking. They simply removed the charge, no haggling, no second guessing. We appreciated that. Very professional customer service. We stayed for a week and the housekeeping staff was always very good about anything we needed. A little disappointed there was no refrigerator. One was available for the week for $20 (and we stayed for a week). Not sure what a nightly charge would be. I wouldn't have minded paying $20 for the week, but we declined the frig, since there was no microwave either. An inconvenience, but not a negative, as long as you are forewarned. In downtown Chicago there are 24-hour drug stores and convenience stores every block, so we never wanted for cold drinks, cheap snacks, fresh fruit, and the like. The hotel location is prime. Several bus lines run along Michigan Ave and are only a block from the hotel, plus buses into the Loop are easy to find too. Check out www.transitchicago.com to easily find a route to the museums, neighborhoods, or downtown. We bought the unlimited-use bus pass for 7 days for $23.00 (at the Walgreen's two blocks from the hotel). We easily made it to Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Wrigleyville, Kedzie, all the downtown museums, and the science and industry museum south of downtown. My wife was using a cane, so at times we hopped on a bus just for a few blocks to save her legs from the walking. We found this hotel through Interval World and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a night in the city.”
Reviews.Author: felicity1106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate an anniversary and attend a Blackhawks game, and could not have asked for a better hotel. We shopped around for good rates, and paid a very decent rate for a king sized room for a night. The location was perfect for what we had planned to do (15 minute cab ride to the United Center, a couple blocks from navy pier and only a block off of Michigan Ave.) First, the valet parking was a little steep (although, normal for the city), so we parked at Navy Pier (14$ for 24 hours) and took a cab over to the hotel. Check in went smoothly and quickly (Emily was very sweet and efficient). We were able to choose the floor we stayed on. We ended up on the 37th floor with an amazing view of both the lake and Michigan Ave. Our room was amazing, and much more than we expected. We were both very impressed by everything in the room. The only problem that I encountered was that the lighted makeup mirror in the bathroom did not turn on, but it was not a real problem as I didn't really use it. I also loved the full length mirror in the room. We were not in the room for very long, pretty much just used it to sleep, but the time we were in there, we loved it. The bed was AMAZING. We agreed that it was one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in and wished we had the hotel for a second night, just for that reason! I read some complaints about the elevators being slow, but we did not encounter anything like that. This could have been because we were there on a Wednesday night, and the hotel did not seem particularly crowded (in fact, I think we only encountered one other guest the entire time there.) Also, we did not notice any of the noise that I read about in other reviews. They also had free wifi (which is apparently not the case at some hotels these days) and it was very fast and easy to access. We ended up getting some food and drinks in the restaurant attached to the hotel, both before and after the hockey game. Both of us really liked the atmosphere of the bar, and the nachos were pretty delicious, also. My boyfriend also really liked the selection of beers that were available. The only thing that turned me off a bit, was at checkout, we asked to check our bags, as we were going to be shopping, going to the art institute, etc for the day. The bellman was not exactly friendly about it, but as he did his job, we were not THAT upset about it. All in all, we loved this hotel and were very impressed. We would definitely come back to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “They made us feel like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: melnette
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a gift for my 30th birthday. We were booked into a lakeview suite, and were thrilled to be placed in a corner room that provided us a beautiful vista of the city (made all the more romantic by the first snowfall of the year). Mary Bravo was our guardian angel, and helped to ensure that our stay was a special one, arranging for a delicious breakfast in bed to make our celebration complete. It is SO rare to experience this level of customer service, and you can be sure that I will be highly recommending this hotel to family and friends. Thank you to everyone who helped to make our city adventure so amazing :>

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location just off the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled over the Thanksgiving holiday and stayed for two nights and weren't dissapointed. While we could not get into our room early (got into town by 11am), the staff gladly held our luggage while we shopped on Michigan Ave. The staff is always cheery and helpful, greeting us each time we left or returned. The hotel is just a block east of Michigan Ave, far enough to be out of the bustly of holiday shoppers but literally a short block away from the action. There are numerous restaurants around the hotel--we never ate at the hotel restaurant. The Corner Bakery is one block away and is perfect for breakfast. Our room was ready before the normal check-in time of 3pm. The view was of another building, but what do you expect from a city hotel. Our 25th-floor room was quiet, despite being located near the Northwestern Hospital--we never heard a siren. The room was a good size, but would have seem larger if they had not used oversized furniture. It also had free Wifi and a nice 32" flat screen TV. The hotel has an outdoor pool at the top of the building, obviously not open when we were there. I had a chance to use the fitness room, which had 4 treadmills, two elipticals, two bikes, benches and dumbells, as well as several upper and lower body weight machines. Only con would be the parking--$40+ a night valet only. I suppose you can park at the hospital (parking garage right across the street) for cheaper, but i would imagine no in-out parking available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Beautiful Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: bkissinger
Reviews.Content: I booked 13 rooms for our Company's Holiday party at the Avenue Hotel. The booking process was simple, and the staff very helpful and easy to work with. The actual stay was great. Everyone loved their rooms. The rooms were decorated very nice and modern - the views were awesome. I can think of no complaints at all regarding our entire stay. From the moment I first called to check availablity, to the moment I checked out after our stay, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: NY_Guy_Traveling
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Avenue Hotel Crowne Plaza for one night for a conference. My experience was nearly completely positive. The room was nice and big with a pretty good view. It had the usual amenities (flat screen television, desk, etc.). The room and bathroom were clean and well-maintained. The furniture and bed were in good condition. There was a minibar I didn't use (just like all mini bars, the items were ridiculously overpriced). One great feature was free wireless Internet that was reliable and fairly fast. The location is ideal if you want to be in the neighborhood surrounding Michigan Avenue. There were a ton of restaurants and stores within easy walking distance. I had a drink in the bar in the lobby of the hotel, and it was quite nice. I only had three small complaints The room rate was not a bargain, but I'm sure that was partially because the conference was going on (I booked too late to get the conference rate, which was only $20 cheaper than what I paid). Travelzoo had deals at comparable hotels in the neighborhood for less than half the price I paid. Also, I found a small candy wrapper in the closet when I was hanging up my coat. The rest of the room was clean, but it did make me wonder about the housekeeping. And room service took longer to deliver my breakfast than the amount of time I was told when I ordered. Luckily, I was running early, so the delay didn't make me late for the conference. But over all, I had a positive stay at the Avenue Crowne Plaza, and I would be happy to stay there again (depending on rates at comparable hotels in the neighborhood).

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nachosmom1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and it was awesome! The location is perfection - walking distance to everything. The staff were extremely helpful and the hotel rooms were really nice and clean. I have never been to Chicago before and I was so relieved that the hotel was close to everything, as I had to walk everywhere. The city is clean, and safe. The weather was unusually warm for this time of year and that made my experience even better. The business centre, although not large, was impressive. Not only do they have free wireless, they also have computers for your use at no charge (both PC & Mac), as well as a printer, which helps when you want to print out your boarding pass. Nice, helpful touch. I had taken the Airport Express to and from the hotel the airport and that was easy as well. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Great location, staff and rooms. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: ryp15
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right in the heart of everything. Efficient friedly staff especially the breakfast staff who were exceptionally nice and helpful. No problems with the ambulance sirens - hardly heard them - though our room looked onto the hospital. Tired after travelling from Florida and walking around Chicago so just ate in the pub in the hotel. Food and service were pretty good quality and value for money. All in all an excellent experience. We like 'walking cities' - and Chicago is wonderful city for that. Pity we were only there for two days so we will be back to visit for longer.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent staff makes staying here a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: HJK13
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for a business weekend during the Chicago Marathon and were still able to get rooms here. The staff is outstanding! From the minute I arrived the staff made me feel welcome and appreciated. Despite the rooms not being ready, due to my arriving earlier than stated check-in time, the staff made an effort to accommodate me. Later that evening, they went out of their way to answer questions and make recommendations on places to eat, and provided our group with written directions and discount coupons. Throughout the stay, the staff was helpful, courteous and friendly, yet extremely professional. The only minor complaints I have are that the air conditioner in the room was very noisy, and the hospital across the street had ambulances arriving all night long each night. It would have been nice if there was coffee available in the lobby, especially while waiting to check in. The attached restaurant, the Elephant and Bottle, is reasonably priced and the food is very good, with some unusual English items on there, like Bangers and Mash, which are excellent. Quiet down the air conditioner and I will stay here next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: pgbears
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days last December. My wife and I come to Chicago every December for a week to see a Bears Game. Loved the spacious king bedroom. Read the reviews about the noise but your are in major US and you are going to hear the sounds of the city. But we did not have problems with this, in fact we kept our windows open at night. We're from Florida, so we love the cold weather. Staff was friendly and the hotel is located 2 min walk from Michigan Ave. Great stay all around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Gaitau
Reviews.Content: The room I had is a suit with separated bedroom with 2 side window viewing downtown Chicago. ihome, nice hair dryer, very small impressive details. Yet, I paid $145. No brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Our children went "Wow, Fantastic"!”
Reviews.Author: fiona50
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel was one of the best hotels we've stayed in. We were lucky enough to have been upgraded to 2 spacious corner suites for the duration of our 5-night stay. There was a separate sitting room in each suite with a big leather settee, complimentary wi-fi, and a coffee/tea machine, flat screen TV in both the bedroom & sitting room. The beds/pillows were the comfiest ever--my husband normally does not sleep well in hotels, but he slept right through each night; even the sirens did not bother us (we accepted it as part of the vibrancy of Chicago!). Curtain clips & earplugs provided. The bathroom was a good-size, with Neutrogena toiletries; big bars of soap (unlike the silly little ones in a lot of other hotels), plentiful large fluffy towels, and a powerful hairdryer. We did not have to wait long for the lifts. There was also a clean & well-equipped business centre. The location can't be beat; very near to shops & most attractions, 6-7 mins brisk walk to John Hancock Tower & metro subway, 10 mins to Oak St beach. Apple store is opposite. The staff are polite & professional, though one receptionist was a bit unsure of herself, probably new to the job. Highly recommended: 1) City Segway Tour (highlight of our trip! VERY easy to use, safe & great fun!) 2) Architectural Boat Cruise 3) Millennium Park & the amazing "Bean" 4) John Hancock Observatory (we bought the "sun & stars" ticket--stunning views of city) 5) Buckingham Fountain---view it during the day & also night-time There is a lot to see & do in Chicago, worth every blister in both my feet!. It's clean, Chicagoans are friendly, and the architecture is fascinating. Excellent diners for brunch--Yolk (new branch opened at McClurg/Grand), West Egg, Lou Mitchells--we went after 10 a.m to avoid the queues. For dinner, try Benny's ChopHouse--a bit expensive but so worth it! BIG TIP: avoid the taxi touts as you come out---we were ripped off, $74 before tip, when a normal fare is approx $40!! Look out for signs to the taxi ranks instead. And finally, thanks to John Choi for a memorable stay at the Hotel, and to Bleuemoon for the recommendation and tips!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was excellent, kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Fore10
Reviews.Content: Our stay was over the Labo Day weekend. Upon arrival we were offered a complimentary upgrade to the "Kid's Suite". As we were checking in, the hostess also arranged for milk and cookies to be sent to our room for my two small children(7 & 4). Upon opening the door, the kids were in heaven! The room was completely decorated for kids. From a nerf hoop to chalk board to a little picnic table with umbrella and even the bedding and toys everywhere! The hotel is one block off of Michigan Ave. which is also known as the Million Dollar Mile. This stretch has all the shopping you could wish for and is very close to several good restaurants. When you leave the Crowne Plaza you come out right next to the Apple Store, and also on the same block as the Disney Store. Overall this trip was spectacular in large part due to the location and hospitality of the hotel and its staff. I would reccommend to take a cab to most places instead of renting a car as parking was $48.00usd per night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: jimsmovie
Reviews.Content: I am a travel manager for a studio company based in Las Angelas and was recently in Chicago for the filming of Transformers 3. I was in a huge bind getting rooms in Chicago. All I can say is Jael Rafuse and Mik Mahdavi saved me that week. I found Jael (knew her from a previous hotel) on a Sunday and needed the rooms for Tuesday. She went above and beyond her call of duty accomadating our rooms. We ended up staying over the origonal negotiated nights and Jael and Mik were more then accomadating. From the doorman to the housekeepers, all of my crew said the staff were awesome and the hotel was wonderful. They really appreciated the suite upgrades and the area as it was only 10 minutes to the office. The location is close to everything so after work the crew always had something to get into. I am greatfull for the hard work and pride the staff displayed and will never use anyone but the Avenue Crowne Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Good location downtown chicago”
Reviews.Author: airone367
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite a typical Crowne Plaza(there are many). Clean, good staff luxurious interior and fairly good value for money. What I did not like about this place is the parking fees. What a rip off!!!!! Park your car elsewhere! The breakfast was barely acceptable and expensive. There are several breakfast places within a block or two with better food at more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok.”
Reviews.Author: DublinAurelie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza as it had an outdoor swimming pool and Chicago in August is very hot. Great location for shopping. Very impersonal hotel. The room was very dark but of a good size. It does need redecorating. The pool was very nice - what a pity there were not a few more loungers. What genius bought the loungers? Because of their shape you can only lie on your back. Impossible to lie on your tummy to get your back tanned. if you want a central hotel for city sightseeing and shopping it is fine. Not a hotel for a romantic getaway. Would love to know what other hotels in Chicago have an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: stuyniski
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. One block off of michigan. Pool is outstainf on the 40th floor. Big rooms. Had a 1 bedroom suite. Outstainding views of everything. Bell stand was waiting to help you with or without a tip. Breakfest on the 40th floor was a little high at $17. but you can get coffee at the resturant in the lobby. Parking was standard at $48. We drove in at 9am and left the next day at 2pm and no extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ms1970
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed this weekend with my stay at the Avenue. I booked through Priceline and chose a 4 star hotel. My winning bid was from the Avenue. Priceline has the Avenue as a 4 star along with the Sofitel, W and Westin's. No way - I would have rather stayed at the Courtyard. I realized that we were across the street from Northwestern Memorial Hospital, but we were on the 37th floor. Still from midnight til 5 am - there was an ambulance every hour that woke me up. Also the group of drunk girls that woke up the entire floor around 2am did not help. Another guest had to go out and yell at them. The wall a/c unit was so loud that when I came bac up to the room, my wife could not hear me knocking on the door. Also, when we could not watch a movie on pay per view, the front desk told us that the hotel got rid of it a few months ago. I am not sure I have ever stayed in a hotel that did not have pay per view. Lastly, there were no convenient plugs anywhere in the room. Had to plug one phone in the bathroom, but then could not shut the bathroom door based on where the plug was located. Other phone had to put on the floor under the table next to the chair. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Camel140791
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got home from a six-night stay at this hotel and we cannot say enough about the facility and the staff. This property is second to none. The hotel is extremely clean and very safe. We stayed on the 31st floor and the view was awesome. The rooftop pool is a great place to unwind after a busy day exploring this great city. We were blessed to have clear skies and a moon to shine down on us. The hotel is within walking distance to everything. If I am ever afforded the chance to visit Chicago again this hotel will be where I stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to use award points”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseIllinois
Reviews.Content: Booked using award points - I'm a gold priority member...location is the best - especially if you want to do the Mag mile. I took my wife and daughter for pre-college shopping. Front desk & staff personnel were all very courteous and helpful. Yes, as other reviews have said, you can occasionally hear the sirens as you are close to the hospital -but that was not an issue as the insulation is pretty good -and that's not the hotels fault anyway. Nice comfortable beds -great staff, good location...we just booked another night for week before Xmas.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went right”
Reviews.Author: KirD
Reviews.Content: All the things one would expect from a well run hotel came together. Quick check in to a clean room and efficient check out. Staff was excellent with directions and the doormen (no doorwomen) were helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bathrooms need update”
Reviews.Author: achicagofamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for conference with employees. Hotel seemed to have problems with air conditioning. Conference room warm. I was in corner tech room with great view of sw. Room fine except bathroom grungy and bed not comfortable. Other room had double beds Adequate, but nothing too impressive. Elevators small and take forever. Pleasant check in. Concierge man looked disturbed. Doubt I would ever return for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the regualr joe, not too fancy schmanzy”
Reviews.Author: ANDY74361
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful form the moment you walk up to the hotel. Bellman/doormen are wonderful and friendly. Desk clerks very accommodating. The concierge...what a guy! And kudos to the night manager (did not get his name) dealt with an unruly hotel guest like a true professional. It was quite the scene and we joked with him every time we saw him after that. Very comfy beds. We had a suite and did not ever use the living room except to make coffee. Very close to many things we wanted to do and most were within walking distance (Navy Pier, train to Wrigley, Mag mile.....). If you stay at any downtown hotel you are going to hear sirens, with a comfy bed, clips to hold the curtains shut and complimentary ear plugs and eye shade (we did not use) you block this out. How much are you in your room any way? Restaurant attached, not too pricy. Many within walking distance including Gino's East (1/2 block). We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Magic happens at the Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: alicecl
Reviews.Content: Our son's wedding party had almost 100 of us staying at the Avenue Hotel from 2 days for some to almost a week for many others. Everybody had a fabulous time there. The hotel is upscale, thorougly modern, clean, quiet and cosy. My brother's young family stayed in a family room which is furnished with basket ball hoop, picnic table and toy chest for young children. I had a wonderful and memorable visit in their room. The reservation folks are most accommodating of the various arrival times, and the front desk staff are very helpful. Our meet and greet luncheon party catered in one of the event rooms were fabulous. They provided us with a generous room which was bright and spacious where the buffet presentation was lovely , the food delicious and the service excellent. Their audio/video equipment was first class, taking many of us down a lovely memory lane. There are quite a few public areas on the 7th and 13th fl where many of us congretated late into the evening to catch up, with plenty of hugs and tears to go along. The young cousins enjoyed the outdoor swimming pool on the 40th floor while the grannies simply sat and enjoyed the aerial view of Chicago's skyline. The hotel location is tops! The Magnificient Mile of N. Michigan Ave is actually just around the corner! Our group partied together by walking everywhere. We walked to the Chicago River boat tour, Navy Pier, the Millenium Park and the Art Institute. We walked to Dominick's for fresh fruit and bottled water. We dined together at the Corner Bakery, TGIF, Gino's Pizza East, Portillo's Hot Dogs, Panera Bread, Pockets and Morton's. The amazing grace is that they are all within 15 minutes of walking distance, and some are simply just around the corner. I must say we walked up our appetite, and after a scrumptuous dinner, we walked it off by heading out to the Lake to cool off in a hot summer evening. The Avenue Hotel was home away from home for a wonderful and magical week of wedding celebration. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “sirens - next to ER”
Reviews.Author: katylandberg
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel!!!!!Next to E.R.,lots of sirens!!!!!!Tiny bathroom,not very clean!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: uiguy
Reviews.Content: Great views of the city from higher floors. Staff do try hard to be helpful and the elevators sometimes take a while to arrive. Big rooms very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room!”
Reviews.Author: ozarksusie
Reviews.Content: We went through Sams club & got a package for airfare & hotel. This hotel was nice, I told them we would be celebrating our anniversary while we were there so they put us up in a bigger room that had a leather sofa & walk in closet, it was nice & roomy. I felt that the front desk wasn't real helpful with information, so I would recommended looking for things to do at home & booking in advance mostly for restaurants & tours. You hear a lot of sirens from the hospital thats close but it didn't effect our sleep , our air unit ran a lot of the night cause we like to sleep with it pretty cool. Right down the street from the Hotel is the Corner Bakery, we would go every morning for breakfast, I had the hot oatmeal, it was really good had walnuts, craisins & almonds & brown sugar on top. I did minus the brown sugar & add splenda. It also came with a sweet crips, there yummy! I even bought a couple bags to take home! This hotel was close to everything for the most part but we did take a cab the day we went to the museums. Be sure & go to that area and also see the park & the cool fountains & things..we also took the Tastebud tour bought those tickets online really enjoyed it, great reviews! Also take a boat ride out of Navy Pier, we did a night cruise & the beauty of seeing the city light up from afar is amazing! Enjoy you trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jweavester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. I would recommend that they have a store inside for late night needs. Also the elevators take forever, as only three actually go to the room floors. But the beds are super comfy, view isn't great. Thanks for the eye mask and ear plugs. One of the last few places that still has free internet at the business center and WiFi in the rooms. My mom is really picky and she liked this hotel too. My dad is not a fan of elevators so the fact that they were small and rooms don't start till the 16th floor didn't sit really well, but once in the elevator it went pretty fast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, elegance, style and location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Bleuemoon2
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I travelled to Chicago in late May 2010 for our first trip to Chicago. After researching many hotels in the downtown area based on location and price we narrowed our choices down to a few that fit our requirements. One of the elements that we were interested in was a swimming pool, so I sent an email to the Crowne Plaza Avenue Chicago to see if it was opened, and their quick response was that it was under repair until the Memorial Day weekend, but we received incentive to try this hotel anyway, and how glad we are that we did. Personal attention was given by management in the form of our email, when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted and handle professionally and expediently. Once we arrived in our room we were very pleased by the comfort and luxury of our corner suite, which was spacious, well appointed and very relaxing and favored a view of the surrounding buildings, (we were on the 27th floor, but in the Miracle Mile part of Chicago where this hotel is located, most buildings are double that in height), but we were too busy to spend much time looking out at the view. What we did love about our room was the washroom facilities, shower and tub, simply yet modern and clean. But first and foremost was our bed, which was extremely comfortable and may have actually been the best hotel bed I have ever slept on, definitely high quality for comfort and support and king sized too. My spouse and I had 3 great night's worth of sleep, which is more important than you think when you are travelling away from home. We were right beside the Miracle Mile and in close proximity to everything that you might want to do in Chicago if you are on a visit. What we did in Chicago that I would recommend. 1. The Architectural River Cruise 2. A trip to the Skydeck at the Willis Tower.........and do step out on the Ledge......if you dare! 3. Shopping on the Miracle Mile, even if it is window shopping. 4. Grant's Park 5. Lou Mitchell's for breakfast.........simply the best! 6. Get a CTA day pass to get around, if you want to go to a baseball game or even somewhere too far to walk. 7. Rent A Bike and take a ride and get some excercise on the Lakefront. 8. Take the Hop on and Hop off double decker bus. 9. Do eat a deep dish pizza...........they're not as filling as you may think! 10. We ran out of time to do everything we wanted..........so we will come back again and stay at the Crowne Plaza Avenue Downtown Chicago. I give this hotel 5 stars all the way around because it met our needs and went beyond, the service was awesome and the room extremely comfortable and relaxing, the bed comfort second to none. Thank you Crowne Plaza Chicago Downtown for being our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “I Would Not Rate This A 4* Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: merc30
Reviews.Content: 1. I booked through Hotwire and I saved $8.27. I do not feel this is exceptable, considering they always make it look like you are going to save about 40%. I talked to a Hotwire customer service representative and he said that technically if I saved $1.00 it was not false advertisement. I disaree!! Do not use Hotwire,you have no guarantee that you will save more than $1.00. 2. I did not feel this hotel compared to any other 4* hotels that I have visited. 3. They advertise a pool. First it is under renovation and second it doesn't look like it will be done for the whole season (summer) according to the sign on the door of the pool. Second, the picture shows a roof top pool, but it looks closed in. This is not the case, it is an outdoor pool. So, even when it is finished, it will be open only in the summer months. Do not count on going to this pool for your children to swim. Pick another hotel!! 4. The rooms were not up to standards of a four star hotel. The sheets were rough to the touch also. There was no fan in the bathroom. Paint chipped, etc. 5. The location makes this hotel somewhat desirable, close to magnificant mile, but across the street from the Hospital. Sirens heard all the time. This would convince me to stay somewhere else. 6. Overall, I do not rate this a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a King Suite, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel4FunPartners
Reviews.Content: We requested a King size bed at the end of a hallway and received a very nice, large King suite. I appreciated the little extras such as clips to hold the curtains closed, lighted make-up mirror, blankets for the bed so we could throw off the ridiculous duvet that hotels seem to think are comfortable (think sleeping bag in Phoenix mid-summer), a standard size blow dryer (not the usual mini versions). Receptionist at check-in was friendly. Bed was very comfortable (we both are airline employees and have experienced plenty of hotel beds). The location was excellent for taking public transportation, shopping, and dining. For quick meals check out The Corner Bakery one block south on St. Clair. Great soups, salads, sandwiches, pasta, and desserts. The one drawback as mentioned by others was the sirens during the night as the hotel is near Northwestern Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: DBW1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Hotel from May 9-13, 2010. I was in town to attend a business conference on my first trip to Chicago. SERVICE & DINING The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful staff. The location was perfect as the conference was next door at the Allerton, and was only steps away from the Magnificent Mile shopping / dining district. The E&C pub off the lobby was very good for breakfasts and the occasional dinner â€“ excellent selection of on-tap beers for the Canadian traveller that isnâ€™t the biggest fan of American suds (although, I did try the Fat Tire Ale and the Samuel Adams Lager, and both were quite nice). Also, just being in a pub is about as close to a â€œhome-away-from-homeâ€� type feeling as one can get when visiting the US from Canada. Off-site, one of the best meals I had was at Giordanoâ€™s pizzeria which is only three short blocks away â€“ absolutely outstanding deep-dish pizza, but be prepared for a bit of a wait for the food! That said, deep-dish is a must do in Chicago, and this is the place to do it! ACCOMMODATIONS The room was fairly large, but with an awkward setup that made navigating around the king bed and office desk/chair somewhat challenging. The dÃ©cor needs some updating though in terms of drapery, wallpaper and carpeting (the hallways outside the rooms could also use some freshening-up). The king bed & pillows were exceptionally comfortable! Seriously, I really canâ€™t emphasize enough how comfortable this bed was â€“ I slept like a rock every night! The windows opened to allow for fresh air, and the ac/heater worked perfectly (although it was a little noisy). The washroom wallpaper was peeling slightly, the toilet looks like a public washroom unit, and thereâ€™s no exhaust fan in the washroom (this is where opening the window comes in handy!). That said, the room was very clean and was kept that way every day by the staff. OVERALL For the price I paid (less than $100 US per night pre-paid), this was an outstanding hotel for the location! I thoroughly enjoyed my Chicago experience and am looking forward to bringing my family to the Windy City for some vacation time! BYE THE WAYâ€¦ If youâ€™re travelling to Chicago from Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal etc., I would highly recommend Porter Airlines â€“ I just cannot say enough good things about this company! I have been flying with Porter for several years now, and they are certainly my regional carrier of choice. The staff, service and flights are impeccable, and the prices canâ€™t be beaten (return flight from Ottawa to Chicago was about $350). Porter is the way to go folks â€“ try it and youâ€™ll likely never fly Air Canada again (unless Porter canâ€™t get you there)! This is one airline that truly deserves all the success it has achieved over the past few years â€“ keep it up Porter (no pun intended)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Ketchtwenty2
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. My room was huge. The staff was courteous and helpful. I travel for business a lot. I have had plenty of nice hotels in downtown Chicago and this one ranked near the top....probably the best for what the room cost. Location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: holysage
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on the 9'th of May for one night at the Avenue Crowne Plaza in downtown Chicago. The reason we chose this hotel was that it was a special occasion for us and we wanted to stay in an excellent hotel and the reviews for your hotel were good. But once we checked in, we were VERY disappointed with the level of service provided to us. The receptionist who checked us in, a woman named Arta, was very impolite and did not even have the courtesy to give us a smile. We had booked the room using a friend and family quote and she made us feel as if we had done something wrong by using a coupon provided by your hotel itself. After booking the rooms on the internet we had placed a request the the rooms be close to each other and preferable on a higher floor as it was our first time in Chicago and we would have liked a nice view. When we checked in, Arta said she did not receive any request and gave us what was available. When we went to see the rooms, we were very disappointed. One of the rooms (3220) were still ok, but the other one (3219) was much smaller, dirtier and had a broken fridge. We went down to the receptionist and when we told her we did not like the room, she gave us attitude and said "Whats wrong with the room? Its a nice room." She offered us another room but it turned out that it was a similar room on a floor that was much lower than our friends' rooms. So we decided to stay in the original room, even though we were not comfortable there. We were highly disappointed with the overall experience, from check in to check out. We spent extra money because we wanted to stay in the Crowne Plaza and experience a different level of comfort but after this experience, I feel we would be better off staying in a Days Inn or a Motel 6 that would have the same level of service but at least a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice, professional hotel, with an english style pub.”
Reviews.Author: Oscars_Wild
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little small, but perfectly acceptable given the extraordinary location just off the Magnificent Mile. The beds were brilliantly comfortable, the views extraordinary and the staff friendly. The pub downstairs was a pleasant place to spend a few hours, but hardly worth considering given whats on the doorstep. There was a pool but in common to most of Chicago it wasn't available before May. Pity. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value / find”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: Like most other reviewers, we found this hotel to be above average in every way. The rooms were super clean, the rooms were nice, the location was excellent, etc., just about everything you would expect from a nice hotel right off Michigan Av. There are lots of eateries in the area, lots of shopping, the Water Tower, John Hancock Bldg and the beach are all easily walkable. It's a little of a hike to Millennium Park and the Loop, but it's doable. It's close to public transport (many buses right on Michigan Av, e.g. to Lincoln Park), it's about 4 blocks to the nearest "L" stop. WiFi is free, there's a gym, a rooftop pool (only in summer); there is a restaurant attached (Elephant and Castle). There is a Corner Bakery a block away as well as a zillion Starbucks. Parking is pricy here ($48 / day valet). There is self-parking in the area for a bit less (e.g. Olympia Center for $31 / day self-park). All in all, compared to the cost of other hotels in the area, we felt this was a good value (at $<150 / day for 2 people). I was very annoyed at not being able to check in at 2:30 (check-in is at 3).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, No Faults Found”
Reviews.Author: mikeydog
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed three nights at this property. From check-in to check-out, the stay was great. Actually entered the wrong hotel when we first arrived. We first tried to check into the property next door which looked amazing. We both left hoping our true hotel would be the same. And it was. Check-in took less than 10 minutes. The room was spacious with two queen beds. Very clean room. Called the front desk twice. Once because the TV wouldn't work when we first arrived and a second time for more pillows. Both times, our requests were met within ten minutes. I must say the best part about this hotel besides the location (steps from Mag Mile), are the beds. The beds were perhaps some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in in a hotel. They were great to crash after walking all over the city! Almost wanted to buy one and take one home! All in all a great stay. The value, the service, the rooms. Nothing adverse found at all. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location, two-thumbs-up!!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I am a US travel agent (23 years now) and stay in Chicago often, since I am only a 3+ hour drive away, my son attends the University of Chicago, and I just LOVE the city! To be honest, I usually stay at several of the Hilton properties around Chicago because I am an Hhonors Diamond level, but this stay was already pre-arranged for our group, and I stay at Holiday Inn/Priority Club properties as a back-up. I was pleasantly surprised at the room quality, outstanding service and superb location, especially for the price! We easily walked a block or two to the John Hancock Center for evening cocktails, had only a few streets to all of the famous Chicago restaurants & shopping spots, and quick, unlimited in-out priviledges for the valet parking that was connected to the hotel lobby ($46/nt.) Sarah at the front desk was my angel, as at check-in, I asked for a possible upgrade to a suite, so that our group could congregate in one room and relax, after our daily convention meetings. She not only was able to upgrade me, she took the time to upgrade ALL 5 of the rooms in our party to 2-room suites, which were spacious, super-comfortable, and made our business trip so much more pleasant and affordable! (We found a liquor store closeby where we purchased some beer, wine & snacks that we shared in the suite, each night!) It saved us all from a heafty bar bill, as the adjacent restaurant had the typcial Chicago prices for food and beverages. Sarah is a real asset to this hotel, so be sure she is the one who handles your check-in and questions! (I thought for sure she was the hotel manager, as she was so professional and it seemed that the other employees kept asking her questions all the time! If the GM reads these threads, you need to keep that girl around for awhile! :) I guess my only complaint would be the pricey breakfast that is offered upstairs in the lounge. My Diamond priviledges at Hiltons/Homewoods/Doubletrees/Embassy Suites & even The Whit Chicago, always include continental breakfast with the room rate. This hotel charges $18 for breakfast, which I didn't think was worth it. A more reasonable option for convention attendees & families would be very popular, if offered! I just walked across the street one block to the Corner Bakery and had a hot sandwhich and coffer for under $6 bucks. I know that sounds a bit petty when staying in Chicago, but after a few days, that $18/day could easily add up to a nice meal at Cheesecake Factory or Ed Debevics, when most of us just want a muffin and some juice for breakfast, anyway! The hotel pool was under renovation, so we didn't use that on this visit, either. I would recommend this hotel for the clean, large rooms, good staff and primo location. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for Peace & Quiet, as it is located next to the hospital, and you typically hear sirens non-stop. (I like city noise so I just tune them out, but if I was deliberately trying to sleep before a long flight or maybe a job interview, I'd choose somewhere with less street noise & traffic!) Still, I don't think you'll be disappointed staying here! Check out their rate that includes a jewelry choice AND room for only $149/nt! Their specials are very good!

Reviews.Title: “Awaken to a stinch of ciggarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: bkkrogman
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great, excellent location, right off Michigan Ave,and Apple store was visible from our room. The rates were great as well. Check in very easy, our room was ready when we arrived. Then at 6:15 in the morn (after a night of fun ;)) we were awoken by the smell of ciggarette smoke. My friend had to use her inhaler within minutes of waking up. Overall thought the hotel was o.k. Sheraton Towers is still my fave!

Reviews.Title: “A cracking suite just off the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: PC&JC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Avenue in March and we were there for the St. Patrick's Day celebrations. It's a nice hotel and very well located, just a few steps from the Magnificent Mile and the associated shopping. We took a taxi from O'Hare and I'd advise anyone doing this to hand over the address to the driver, we said we needed The Avenue on E.Huron and said it was a Crowne Plaza, then we were taken to the wrong Crowne Plaza. It was quickly sorted and no real problem but I believe the hotel recently changed name so to avoid confusion, hand over the address (most taxi drivers we used didn't speak very good English either, so that made things harder) We booked a one bedroom suite and were lucky to get a 35th floor corner suite, with excellent views of the city. It was a very large suite, king bed, TV in each room, individual heating in each room, wi-fi, mini bar, excellent coffee machine etc There was no food included but for the price we paid, this wasn't an issue. There is an Elephant and Castle pub in the same building and while I'm not one for visiting "English" or "Irish" pubs while away from home, this was more of a restaurant selling mighty fine food, with some decent beers on tap. If you're looking for a one bedroom suite, a minute from the shops, you'll struggle to find anything this good at such a good price. It's only a 10 minute walk to the Wrigley Building/ Chicago River, or 15 minutes to Cloud Gate (The Bean). It's only 5 minutes from the Water Tower and John Hancock Building and a few more steps to the Excellent Cheesecake Factory! A small tip - if you're going up the Willis (Sears) Tower, it opens around 10, so go a little earlier and visit Lou Mitchell's Cafe a couple of blocks away. It's an original at the start of Route 66, you're given a small doughnut on arrival, the ladies get a free box of milk duds, the panckaes are huge, the service is excellent and you won't need anything else until much later on! We loved Chicago, cold and windy in March but not too busy.

Reviews.Title: “We've found our Magnificent Mile home”
Reviews.Author: Shauny874
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip for a couple of nights and wish we would've book for our usual 4 nights instead of two. The location and price of this place is unbelievable. It is steps away from Michigan Ave and within walking distance going either downtown or further north on Michigan. There is a restaurant on site but it's surrounded by places to shop, eat, entertain, everything. I was really impressed. We booked online on their direct site the day before and purchased the Park and Go rate since the parking in the adjoining self lot was about the same and you get valet by booking online. We pulled up and was greeted by a friendly doorman who asked questions and advised us on what we needed to do promptly. I stayed in the car while my hubby checked us in. We took our bags and our car was parked for us. My hubby advised us that although we couldn't get a higher floor (which we requested), Kim provided us with an upgrade to a corner room which included a sofa, chair and desk. It was a little mini suite. The rooms were NICE. LOVED the blackout drapes, the rainshower in the bathroom, etc. This will be our regular downtown hotel in the future as we visit quite often. If I have to give cons they are (we were told there were no high floor rooms available but heard 2 other couples AFTER us given rooms on the 30th floor), the shower water didn't have enough pressure, and they didn't put a flatscreen in the bedroom but there was one in the sitting area. That's all I got. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location only”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All you are really getting here is a downtown locale, which is fine if you're only using it to sleep. Only a few elevators service around 40 floors so you're better off not being in the hotel. Service was adequate nothing to write home about... Same with the room. Except there was something wrong with the heater which kept rattling when it was on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: fanman99
Reviews.Content: Early check in with no hesitation and location was great. Close walk to Mich Ave and many great restaurants. Staff was extremely helpful handling us at check in with three children. Rooms was nice, clean and beds were very comfortable. Will be back to enjoy when in Chicago. Bellman and doorman were great!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews from this site were FAR better than what we experienced”
Reviews.Author: Noveltraveler6
Reviews.Content: I believe the first error on our part was booking this hotel through Priceline. My family is from Chicago, however, I'd never stayed at this particular hotel before. This was my boyfriends first trip to Chicago for a long weekend... St. Patrick's Day weekend. After booking the hotel, we called and asked if there was a way to reserve a king room. We were told we had to wait until the day of our reservations, but it shouldn't be a problem since they had plenty of rooms available. We waited. My boyfriend was flying in from the east coast and wouldn't be arriving until late... like nearly 9:30 p.m. We called the day of our reservation only to be told that we couldn't request a king room. Okay...Would it be possible for an early check in by me, his girlfriend, to ensure that we got the room we wanted? Not possible. The name was reserved in my boyfriends name, not mine and we would have to switch it by contacting Priceline. Big hassle. So, we decided to take our chances and wait until we arrived late. We got a basic room with two queen beds and a terrific view of air conditioning units. We generally stay in a 4 star or better hotels, but this fell far below our expectations. The bathroom was small and it didn't have a fan. That was inconvenient due to the steam from the shower... The door had a large gap under it and we shoved a bath towel under the door to keep the noise down from the cleaning staff or other hotel guests. The thermostat was difficult to use too. It ran constantly... either blowing cold air or hot. We ordered room service the first morning which was pretty good, so no problems there. Pricey, but it usually is. All in all... we won't stay in this hotel again. It wasn't a great enough experience for us to want to do it or recommend it to family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: stora
Reviews.Content: After having our flight cancelled from the UK we arrived at the hotel four hours late after being up for nearly twenty four hours. It was a lovely suprise to find out that we have been up graded to a Studio Suite as we were staying for four nights. We had paid extra for two queen beds but this room had plenty of room and two armchairs. The elephant & castle was fine for breakfast although it did have a bit of a limited menu and if you drink tea I would drink something else as it was lukewarm each time and the tea was really weak. All the staff were really friendly and Verne on the help desk was just that very helpful. The hotel is very close to the Magnificent Mile and the best inside mall is in Water Tower place which has more normal shops and a good Macy.
