We visited the Field Museum ( Great ), the Wllis Tower ( very high ) the open top bus tour ( very cold ) and the Lincoln Park Zoo ( Long walk from hotel but got the 151 bus back ). All in all a great visit but it seems prices in the USA has risen a lot since we were shopping last time in Minneapolis in Dec 2008. A sign of the times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Wanting to buy a zebra chair ever since checking out”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this place. The decor, the rooms, the staff - they were all incredible. No complaints, concerns, or regrets. Loved the hotel, and loved the zebra chair in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would want in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wondermomToronto
Reviews.Content: Avenue, Crowne Plaza had everything I needed. I arrived early and was immediately welcomed by the front desk and was given a complimentary upgrade to a larger room. I imagine it had to do with it being slow and had a lower occupancy. Check in was quick and efficient. Upon arriving in my room, the t.v. was on and some lights. Within a few minutes the phone rang and it was the front desk asking if everything was to my liking and if there was anything else they could do for me just ask. The room was nicely styled and very large and roomy. Bed and bedding was extremely comfortable as well as the towels were soft and plush. Bathroom was updated but not renovated, could have used a new tub and better water pressure. I was on the 28th floor so the view was amazing and it was so nice to have these huge windows that ran the width of the room. The complimentary coffee in the room was nice, was well as some additional amenities like a magnifying mirror and free wireless Internet. The only short comings of this hotel or room were that the heating system was noisy, no safe in room(can use the safes at the front desk) and you do hear the sirens going to the hospital which is right around the corner. Location was great, everything is in walking distance. I would definately stay here again, based on the amazing rate I received and the upgrade. I think more hotels should offer free upgrades if they are not full.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great resturant attached to it”
Reviews.Author: SugaTn
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel. We are both germaphobes when it comes to cleanliness of hotels, but there were no issues here. Check in was good and quick. The business area provides you with free and unlimited access to the computer which is very convenient. Within the hotel is this wonderful resturant called Elephant and Castle. Just as my mom and I are germaphobes, we are also very picky eaters, but we were so satisfied with the service and the taste of the food. We call Elephant and Castle our resturant and whenever we are in Chicago, we plan to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawks80
Reviews.Content: The Avenue is one of our favorite Chicago hotels for its location, rooms, and overall value. Often this is one of the best values in the entire Michigan Avenue area, and the hotel itself will sometimes send you great rate offers through email. It's right across the street from the Omni, which charges three times more in most cases. We've stayed there at least 3 times in the past year or two. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, and the staff is quite friendly. The hotel restaurant is a wonderful pub-style bar which has great food, deserts, and a great selection of draft beers and ciders. It's within walking distance to Watertower Place and most other Michigan Avenue locations. It's also right next door to one of Chicago's best pizza places: Gino's East. If you can grab a room in the $100-175 range, it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: oakchick
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Chicago in September 2009 for a girls weekend. 16 of us celebrating a friends birthday. After hours spent searching the net for hotel rooms, we settled with Avenue Hotel because of the location and the suites. We were not disappointed. The rooms and suites were very nice. The beds were heavenly. Location was awesome. Everything within walking distance. The staff was very accomodating and helpful, especially with our large group. (even at 3:00 am when security was called to one of our rooms because we were being too noisy ) My only two very small complaints: the doormen's uniforms seemed dirty and stained. (generally not a good first impression) Second, although the bathrooms seemed newly renovated, they were quite small. Overall I would definitely recommand to friends and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location just off the Mag Mile!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid929
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights and were very pleased with the hotel. We upgraded to a suite on the 36th floor and had a great view of the Mag Mile. It was a pleasant room and my only complaint would be that I wish the overhead lighting was better. The bed was so comfortable and we slept like babies! The location can't be beat. We easily walked to the Lincoln Park Zoo one afternoon and to the Art Museum the next. Check-in and check-out was very smooth and the staff is welcoming and efficient. It's a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop for the business traveler or vacationer”
Reviews.Author: pdxmike
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed great service here from the bellmen, staff and concierge. Rooms were smallish, but nice and clean. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Bad experience :(”
Reviews.Author: agusiiia
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 14th floor on a Sunday night with my boyfriend. Location is amazing if youre looking to do some shopping and dining, the hotel i literally right next to the apple store :) Beds are amazingly comfortable and the rooms are really big. the place is kinda old but nicely remodeled, the water in the shower wasent as hot as i wanted it to be. I only had a problem wit 2 things - our view was overlooking heating and air ducts lol but its wasent a big deal since we live in the suburbs of chi and were down there quite often. 2nd - We wanted to grab some drinks at the sky lounge but found out it was closed for repairs, we managed to sneak in there at night and the place had amazing views and would have been awesome if it was open. overall got a awesome deal and really had no complaints :)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good location”
Reviews.Author: KeitaLee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, just off of Michigan Ave where all the shops are. However, we were given a room near the elevators and they are so noisy! If you want to sleep in, don't stay here. I have never stayed at a hotel where I can hear all the water pipes in neighboring rooms and the elevator passing every floor. Otherwise, some of the staff members are very friendly and helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places to be Found in Chicago...So NOT Four Star”
Reviews.Author: aussiebk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue for one night for a business trip. I went with a colleague to check in around 2p. Unfortunately, we were told that rooms would not be available until 3p (the check in time). We got back around 4p. I got upstairs to my room and it had an odd smell: moldy almost like someone had smoked in the room. I called to the front desk to change my room. The only room available was the kidâ€™s room (colorful room with plastic toys). It was odd that management or someone from the front desk never came up to smell the room. My colleague came down and smelled the room. She too had a room with a similar scent, but not as bad. As best I can describe â€“ the smell was like an antique cellar. I passed on the kidâ€™s room and stayed put. Later in the night when I returned from a work event around 11p, I turned up my heat. By 1a it was still chilly in the room and I turned the heater up to 85 degreesâ€¦.but it just got colder. By 130a I called the front desk and within 10 minutes an engineer was in my room. Now, I am happy he came so quickly and only took 20 minutes to take apart my heater and clean the filter. By 4a I had to be up for a 6a flight â€“ only having 2 hours of decent sleep. No one at the hotel ever called to apologize or offer anythingâ€”this was customer service at its worst. For a $300/night room rate - I expected more. Basically, this is an outdated hotel desperately in need of upgrades. The reason the heater was spitting out cold air was b/c of build up on the filter â€“ you would think a four star hotel would be constantly monitoring for this. Pluses on this was that the person that checked me in was really helpful in looking up restaurant recommendations and addresses. In general, the staff was responsive, but never went above and beyond. Location is great, but there are so many other hotels with great location. Bed was comfortable and bathroom spacious (but again outdated). I also had a nice partial view of Magnificient Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: elmossle
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay with my wife for our 1st Anniversary and hope to stay here again! Got into town early on a Friday, staff was extremely nice and helpful even though they didn't have our room ready because it was so early. Stored our luggage for us and even let us get some items back out after they had already stored them. Went out and did some sightseeing and came back to check-in which was a breeze and found out that they had given us a free upgrade to a suite because it was our anniversary. Room was very nice and clean with lots of room to spread out and relax. Later on in our stay, I realized I had forgot my shaving gel and call the front desk to see if they help me out since we were running late for our dinner reservations and someone was up to our room in no time flat with some shaving cream. One of the greatest things about this hotel is its location. You are right in the middle of EVERYTHING on Michigan Ave!! You have all the shopping you could want and more with the ability to run your bags up to your room and not drag them all over town. You have quick access to numerous restaurants that are just short walks from the lobby, as well as bus stops across the street that will take you to various museums and other points of interest in the city. The only thing I could see someone faulting this place with is the noise from Northwestern Hospital right next door. We were on the 27th floor and the noise did not bother us at all and my wife is a very light sleeper. Other then that, Avenue Hotel is a great place to stay and enjoy Chicago and we look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star hotel. Location can't be beat though....”
Reviews.Author: evjolin
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we were in Chicago the weekend of some international convention, and thus hotel prices were through the roof!! I have never had trouble getting excellent hotels for a steal in Chicago, but this weekend was an exception. We got a "great" deal for the weekend at the Avenue. Average price per night was $225. My first impressions: Our room was HUGE --you could have fit 4 queen beds in there comfortably. The problem with this is that the tv was so far from the bed, I couldn't read the baseball score! And I have perfect vision. Also, there was a random medical grade hospital seat in our room, even though we weren't a handicapped accessible room. The good: Location is to die for, would stay here again knowing what to expect and loving the location. The beds are comfy. The curtains block out all light :-) It's a clean and comfortable (not exceptional) hotel. The bad: Water pressure is NON existent. I am all for being green, but the shower heads are abysmal. There is no safe in the room, but there are lock boxes at the front desk. This is incredibly inconvenient. I'm not carrying the queen's jewels, but I like to put my jewelry in a safe when I am gone, along with my ipod or camera, or even my wallet if I am not carrying the whole thing. The lock box was SUCH a pain, as I had to constantly wait in line while people were checking in/out to access it. Also, several things in the room were broken--a sliding door on the closet and the vanity light didn't work (was nice that they had a lighted, magnified mirror though). I even mentioned the terrible water pressure when at the lock box, and kind of got a shrugged "sorry" but there's nothing we can do. Summary: All in all, a good hotel if you are prepared for what I consider a 3.5 star experience. I would stay here again, the staff was very nice, the pub had great shepherds pie, and most importantly, the bed was comfortable with great pillows. And the location is fantastic. If you are expecting a 4 star hotel, I would stay elsewhere. Lastly--I know some reviewers complained about sirens/street noise, etc. I heard sirens and noise, but in my opinion it was nothing more than I am used to hearing when staying in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxdogMadison
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February - no complaints. Room was large, clean, and updated. Staff was friendly and the location was great for shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Chips and Balloons”
Reviews.Author: TwitterBug
Reviews.Content: Landed in Chicago for the first time to see the Bears play. Ended up at the Avenue Hotel after some research. The hotel was right in the heart of where you want to be! Staff was very friendly and the E & C downstairs is a great place to have a pint or start the morning off with a breakfast that you will not forget! Room was spacious and well appointed. Across the hall was a little noisy but that group was travelling to the Bears game also and with our door closed you couldn't hear the Canadians Snore. Although at some point we did hear the term "Blue 42 Blue 42 Razor Razor"! The beds were very comfortable with my roommate stating that he could spend all day just lying on it. All in all highly recommend the Avenue Hotel Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Oreo45
Reviews.Content: Asked for a high floor. Views from room window were of Tiffanys one way and the Lake the other. Beautiful & large room & clean. Location was a few steps off Michigan Ave & all the shopping. Helpful staff. Would return if I went back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: spikeylisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 26 September - 30 September 2009. Very efficient, only slight problem we had the room was reserve for us was a King size bed as we are girls didn't want to share a bed. They were like it a charge to change it. We were like no, as clearly said on the paperwork it a double double we were require. Manager sorted it out. The other problem we had with the water draining away in the shower, that was sorted out straight away! Good stuff house keeping. Bath room is bit small, but only one person in the bathroom at one time so I don't know what the fuss was about with people in the past who's been! The bed are so comfortable with nice 4 pillows, felt I was home from home. Reception staff were friendly always spoke as we past no matter what time of day! The Door man sorted out our taxi on our last day. It was ready for us at 5am!! Couldn't fault my stay and would gladly to stay again. We both love Chicago for mainly for two reasons the people and views of the city!! Don't bother about the fireworks at Navy Pier as they are one hit wonders!! Don't eat at Hard Rock Cafe Chicago as food awful, had a fajitas and it was cold. Also don't eat at Pizzeria Uno as its not real one down Ohio St. Totally recommend The Corner Bakery Cafe, which is left out of the hotel, to edge of that block then turn right to end of that block bout 3 min walk!! It was best breakfast I had on our trip! Cinnamon rolls to die for, plus my mate enjoyed her Oatmeal. Sear aka Willis Tower is brilliant especially at twilight. The Hancock tower was good also. Please go to Millennium Park to see the Mirror Bean as that awesome!! I could go on and on as I had a amazing time in Chicago, as enjoyed it more there than New York!! Feel free to contact me if you like to know anything.

Reviews.Title: “overall good service”
Reviews.Author: benbulben
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights oct 1st to 3rd, as we had booked through priceline we were expecting to get a small room near a noisy lift, however, I had rang ahead to ask for a non-smoking room and had mentioned that we were on a special trip--on arrival we were offered an upgrade to a corner suite with a partial view of the lake!!! GREAT. the bed was really comfortable, and we enjoyed our stay . This hotel is minutes away from michigan avenue--for the shops, also an easy walk(less than 10minutes) to the Wendella boat tours We ate in the elephant and castle which is attached to the hotel--basic food , price o.k. service good. was very busy the evening we were there.Had breakfast in the corner bakery which is just around the corner--lovely, We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice rooms,reasonable restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mglu
Reviews.Content: Got this room through Hotwire. Really well appointed, free wireless, ist floor British themed restaurant is reasonably priced for all 3 meals. I would recommend parking a few blocks away vs the $48 next door fee(unless in/out service is important). Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed....but...”
Reviews.Author: floshane
Reviews.Content: I booked using points from my credit card company. I arrived at the hotel at 1:00. Check in time is at 3:00. I was told that my room wasn't ready yet so I checked my luggage and went out to do some exploring. It was raining and I had a cold so I went back at 2:30 hoping my room might be ready a little bit early. Without checking, I was told that the rooms would be ready in 10 minutes. I sat and waited. A few minutes later, people started lining up to check in. I sat until the line went down. I stay at hotels frequently and have never encountered this before. I don't understand why they don't let people check in as their rooms become availalbe. The room was very nice. I played an extra $30 for a room with 2 queen beds versus the king room that I booked. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. I would have slept like a baby except for two things: Lots of sirens all night long and we couldn't get the temperature in the room quite right. The bathroom was a nice size. Plenty of room for two people to share sink space. The second morning there, I lost hot water in the shower. It sounded like the toilet in the room next door flushed right before it happened. It quickly recoverd but a few minutes later, I lost hot water for good. Not a good way to start the day. I called the front desk and they offered to send someone up to look at it but my shower was already over. An apology was all I received. The hotel is in an awesome location. One block off of Michigan Ave and centrally located. I'm just not sure I would stay here again due to the customer service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and dreamy bed”
Reviews.Author: hoosier81
Reviews.Content: We went for our 28th anniversary and had an excellent time We got the standard room with a king size bed on Priceline for $122 a night. The public area is very small and that would limit me paying more, but it was well worth the price we paid. The room was nicely appointed and all the furnishings were very comfortable, but the bed was absolutely awesome--great linens and pillows! The room was not large but was definitely large enough. We had complimentary wireless and a nice ipod dock and flat screen TV. Coffee maker and hair dryer were good quality. Besides the bed, the location was perfect. We were 3/4 mile from Navy Pier which was our farthest walk. The Johns Hancock Bldg., shopping and excellent restaurants were all within 1/2 mile and very walkable. We looked out our window to the corner of Michigan and Huron where Tiffany's, Saks, and Nieman-Marcus are. Valet parking in the garage was a costly surprise at $96 for the two days we were there. Concierge was a little stuffy and didn't volunteer much information. We used the internet to answer most of our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Bushbabie
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a junior suite on the 14th floor, high enough up not to hear most of the traffic noise but not high enough to drown out the emergency vehicles sirens that were arriving, day and night, at the massive hospital across the road. Plus there was a contant thumping noise, maybe a water pump or something to do with the aircon, that also went on day and night. So I found sleeping really difficult, which is a shame as the bed was lovely and comfortable, with pillows to die for! I had a running battle with housekeeping for my extra pilow, every night I would get it out of the wardrobe, and every day they would put it back again... It's a pity they weren't so zealous with the cleaning. On our first night we spilled some sugar on the counter top by the coffee machine, 3 days later it was still there. And the coffe making supplies tray wasn't refilled in all that time, we had to ring down to have some brought up to the room. Other than these niggles we really enjoyed our stay in Chicago and would love to come again. I would stay at the Avenue but would request a room at the back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline- as Four Star- Four Star might be a reach but certainly a solid 3 to 3.5 star. Lobby was quite plain. Four check in desks. Door man very helpful. Room was nice- recently remodelled- nice well lit bathroom, with new fixtures, a big multi streamed shower head with adequate pressure. Towel rich. The room also was spacious. Bed very comfortable. Room was very clean. No closet, just an area in the wall indented with a clothes bar ( found out this hotel used to be a Ramada). Only a couple blocks off Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely suite.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_teacher23
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at six other places, we were quite tired when arriving in Chicago. Avenue Hotel was easy to find and we were pleasantly surprised by quite how close to everything it is located. (Steps from the Mag Mile) Staying here didn't break the bank which meant we had money left to shop unlike other hotels in the area. Checking in was easy and we had a lovely corner suite (2315) with lounge, bathroom and bedroom. The bed was SO comfy, we slept the best we had since arriving in the states 18 days previous! Lovely clean linen and touches like the zebra print dressing gowns and little wardrobe tucked round the corner. The mini bar was well stocked in the lounge. furnished with a very comfy sofa and zebra print arm chair, it was a great place to relax. (Maybe the lighting was a bit odd in this room after being so well considered everywhere else?) The bathroom was well appointed with a great shower, curved rail (Fab!) and lovely plush clean towels, good products and all well cared for. We loved staying here and was only sorry that the weather wasn't better so we could try the rooftop pool. I'd definitely stay here, the doormen were great at hailing cabs and reception staff welcoming and very helpful. Recommendations all round!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago the best city, Avenue hotel the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Averia
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to spend a few days after being in New York for 6 days. We were exhausted and wanted some relax and real holidays. From the begining the people, in Chicago and specially in the hotel were very nice. We got an upgrade, thanks Arta, and we did enjoy every single day in the hotel. The people who works at the hotel are really nice and helpful they are always with a smile and make you feel wellcome. I recommend anyone who has to travel to Chicago to pick this hotel, not only because of the situation, in the magnificient mile, but for the quality of the hotel itself and the value of the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jp_from_paris
Reviews.Content: Like pretty much everyone, the location is excellent for downtown Chicago - within easy distance of buses and the metro. Initially we were given a large room on the 39th floor (fantastic views) but... it was next to the aircon for the hotel. When this kicked in, even the furniture vibrated, to say nothing of the noise. The first offer was to change for a "smaller" room as there was nothing else available - when I saw the room it was a bad joke - small was an understatement. After refusing the substitute of the smaller room, a large room on the 28th floor was found to be available(!) and we moved there and it was fine and comfortable. The front desk staff were really helpful. The downstairs bar is good for lunch / dinner - but avoid it for breakfast as service is slow and less than friendly. A big plus is the business centre where there is the possibility to check-in and print out boarding cards for free, to make the hassle of O'Hare a bit less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location at a Perfect Price”
Reviews.Author: TanKatLuvr
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a really great rate on Priceline the day before our arrival. This hotel has been renovated and I believe used to be the Radisson. We were pleasantly suprised! We could not have aksed for a better location! We took the train from MDW (Orange line and then transfer to Red line) and then walked about 10 minutes to our hotel. We were greeted graciously and upgraded to a very large room with a southern view of the city on the 36th floor. The bedding was the most comfortable I have ever slept on and had a great night's sleep. The front desk called the room within 15=30 mintues to make sure everything was okay. This was when I asked if we were upgraded (cause I hear the standard rooms were small) and the lady said yes. (She was very nice, I can't spell her name, but when I asked, she told us she was from Bulgaria). The only less than positive things about this hotel are: Elevators are VERY TINY and take a while....the A/C units are very loud, but that only bothered us when it would turn off and then turn on later. So I just got up and turned it off and the room stayed cool all night. The room was very modern and spacious. We liked the large leather couch and the zebra chair was sooooo comfortable. Vern, the concierge was very helpful with directions and suggestions. This hotel provided a central location for everything we wanted to see. WE would not hesitate to go back to the Avenue hotel at all. WE were just blocks from Lake Michigan, shops and eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel just steps from North Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Dan R
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this hotel is a 3 to 3.5 star hotel. The staff were friendly and courteous. I found a great deal on a one-bedroom suite. For the most part, the decor and furniture were above average. In the living room, the leather sofa was comfortable. In the bathroom, the shower head and curved shower rod were nice, but the tile was poorly laid and the toilet looked industrial (like in a sports stadium). In the bedroom, the pillows were comfortable, but the waffle texture of the blanket was somewhat uncomfortable. The air conditioning units were moderately loud and the sun made the temperature slightly warm during the afternoon. The complimentary wireless Internet was easy to use and the speed was adequate. The rooftop pool was basic and small. The hotel was located just steps from the heart of North Michigan Avenue shops and attractions. It was also within walking distance of Navy Pier and Millennium Park. I would stay at this hotel again if I found another great deal.

Reviews.Title: “truly a superb hotel for everyone”
Reviews.Author: footiecook
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel through Hotwire for a bargain so wasnot expecting much, but from the moment we arrived we knew we were in for a special holiday. Initially we had a few problems with our room which could have been a problem with our 1 year old, but the staff moved us to a room which was superior & massive. From the house keeping staff to the doormen to the reception staff we were welcomed every time by name and went out of their way to provide us with places we could take a toddler to. The room was always spotlessly clean with fresh towels daily & lovely toiletries. the beds were so comfortable and the pillows made you want to stay in bed. I cannot praise this hotel enough but it was the staff that made our staff one to truely remember

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rueben2007
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located only one block from Michigan Avenue. My room was large and clean with a nice city view (22nd floor). The decor is sleek modern. Nice pictures frames of Chicago. The bathroom is small. The tub water drain very slow. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. The roof pool has nice views of the city and the lakes. However, they need to clean the windows. The food at the hotel restaurant is average. For breakfast I recommend the Corner Bakery Cafe just one block from the hotel. Stay away from the hotel parking lot. They charge $48.00 plus taxes per day. You don't need a car in Chicago. Use public transportation or taxis. Overall, this is a good hotel value for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the Location.”
Reviews.Author: Gav1986
Reviews.Content: The loaction of this hotel is fantastic. Stafff service is a 'could do better'. THe valet parking is laughable $48 for overnight adn the service, well lets say I could've got the car myself a lot quicker, and there was no instructions to how to get the staffs attention! Room spacious and had minibar but no prices given! And no matter how much you take out it did advise there is a $25 refill charge. Overall view this hotel as over priced, definitely paying for location only.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and the tub was peeling”
Reviews.Author: gigila72
Reviews.Content: We thought we'd have a more spacious room with two queens and a couch. Instead there was a little more than enough room to walk on both sides of a King bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: ovj0206
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a centrally located hotel in Chicago that was child friendly. I had found 2 rooms but wasnÂ´t sure which would suit my requirements so I phoned reservations for advice. They offered me the kids room as it had not been available on line with a similar discount as would have been found on travel websites. We got to the hotel late and everything ran smoothly. Check in went quick and the kids got milk and cookies which they loved. The room was spacious, fun (especially for the kids) and comfortable. I liked how the lighting was designed so that the parents could stay up without interrupting the kids. The only thing I wasnÂ´t too happy with, was the size of the bathroom. When trying to bath 2 kids it was a bit difficult manouvering in such a tiny space. I

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pessie01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend spent in Chicago and stayed at The Avenue. The rooms are small and kind of dark but the location can't be beat. We walked to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our Chicago Trip”
Reviews.Author: TraveltheDream
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Avenue in March with 3 friends on a trip from Washington to Chicago to Minnesota. Our stay at the Avenue was the highlight of our trip. The shopping in Chicago is AMAZING!!! and just steps from this hotel! The staff at the hotel were incredible. It was pretty chilly out and the gentleman on around 10pm actually went out to the main road to hail a cab for us, and have it come to the lobby entrance to pick us up. Thank you soooo much. Guests don't forget little things like that, which were really above and beyond in my books! The actual hotel itself is beautiful & modern. The room decor is fantastic & the suites are very well laid out. Thank you for being a part of our vacation and making it so much more than we expected!

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3 1/2 stars just needs a little more TLC”
Reviews.Author: jaycee72
Reviews.Content: Checked in room 2902 on a Friday afternoon. Check in very smooth. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was very small. Tub was a little bit dirty with some tiny hairs that were their prior to us and the tub water did not drain, we had to call maintenace. Hotel was in a good location. The beds were VERY comfy but the pillows a little bit too soft for my liking. Housekeeping was quick in response for toilet paper and towel requests and maintenance. Elevators a bit slow especially around check in or out time. The pool was much much smaller than you see on the hotel website. Employees very accomodating except for Bellmen, if you are not quick with the tip they actually ask for one. Decent hotel for the value. Be careful of the cab drivers, we had different rates to and from airports. We visited Millenium Park, Navy Pier, and Oak Street Beach (pack your own beach towel) Ate at Gino's East for Chicago Deep Dish around the corner from the hotel.. Pizza was like soup, too hot and mushy. Excellent spinach sticks though. Had the best ice cream at the ice cream shop in Millineum Park. Also ate at Weber Grill, got seated right away with reservation. Not overly impressed with this restaurant, it was good steak but I have had better. The Corner Bakery right down the street from the hotel was very very good for breakfast. Niu served Japanese, very cool atmosphere and good food. And one of my fav's was Yogurt Couture on Erie and State, a yogurt bar with every topping imaginable open til 4am on Saturday

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: nanof2
Reviews.Content: Great location, we had a room on the 22nd floor, nice outlook, and quiet. We walked to all the tourist attraction from The Avenue Hotel. Staff extremely polite and helpful. Would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Cubs Weekend”
Reviews.Author: OBSTRT
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago several times a year and was looking for a hotel for a Cubs weekend with a friend. I was not familiar with Avenue Hotel but booked it through a discount hotel website. It turned out to be a great stay for us. The location was very convenient, just one block off Michigan Avenue and very close to the Water Tower area. We found the roof top pool and exercise facilities to be a nice plus too. I went swimming at 7am on Saturday morning and had a wonderful view of Lake Michigan while doing some laps. The hotel beds were very comfortable and everything in the room was very new including the high def flat screen TV. Valet parking at the hotel is a little high at $45/night. There are other lots close by for $20 to $30 per night. The roof top restaurant offered a nice breakfast but we did not eat there. All in all, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had compliments around every corner”
Reviews.Author: michelle_0279
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed downtown for a concert. We chose the Avenue Hotel for price, location, and pool on roof. There must have been a mistake with the price b/c we got so much more than what we paid, $167. We had a corner suite, windows galor in the bedroom and the living area, flat screen, awesome leather couch, which does pull out but was so comfortable did'nt need to, and the zebra chair was the best. FYI, the minibar is sensored so dont remove unless ready to pay. We brought drinks and moved theirs, they charged us b/c the sensor but removed the charge when we explained, No Problem, staff was excellent from start to finish! The decor was great, we kept feeling the textured walls everywhere we went. The pool on the roof was excellent and the Sky lounge for breakfast could not have a better view or fresher fruit (eggs, bacon and toast were great too). The location was perfect for shopping, eating and drinking for a group of girls but very romantic for a couple as well, my man and I will definitely be there soon, Avenue Hotel be ready for us during the Air and Water Show!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent option if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy spot. It is not fancy or spacious. If anything it feels very cramped. The lobby is small and crowded. The rooms are small (and I had a suite). It worked for a business hotel because I got a really good deal and it's in Chicago where hotels get expensive. You are 2 blocks off Michigan Avenue so it's na easy walk. There are some stores nearby and you are a short walk from the Hancock tower. They have a breakfast buffet on the roof - don't bother. The service is slow and sullen (unlike most of the rest of the staff). The food is marginal. You can do better almost anywhere. Would I stay here again - maybe. If I needed a downtown hotel for $100 a night and could get this one then yes. If this hotel was at full price then no. Chicago has lots of great hotels. If you are going to spend some money on the hotel then you should avoid the Avenue and stay at one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: BadgerNomad
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful long weekend at the Avenue Hotel and we'll definitely stay there again. The Avenue has invested wisely and well in amenities that really matter, while paring away costly but less vital elements. You'll find great beds, linens and housekeeping here, for instance, but no fancy lobby or cable TV. That adds up to a great value in a neighborhood where other hotels are charging 30-40% more. Pros: -- Tailored, serenely modern decor; not a floral print anywhere -- Sumptuous bed linens with plenty of pillows -- Clean rooms and public areas -- Huge windows and ample space in our "Junior Suite," essentially a large room with a sitting area nicely furnished with a leather couch, coffee table and armchair. It even had a walk-in closet. -- Kid friendly, but not kid overrun. -- All-pro front desk staff. Jael and Julio went to great lengths to resolve a problem caused by the room discounter we used. -- Casual restaurant and elegant lounge both on premises -- Just a block from the ideal segment of Michigan Ave., where the Water Tower, stores and parks are nirvana for shoppers, people watchers and sightseers. -- Great soundproofing -- A small, pleasant outdoor rooftop pool and deck on the 40th floor is a perfect escape from Chicago's street-level bustle. We saw a family bring in fruit, bread and cheese to picnic with a bird's eye view of the city and lake. -- Brunch in the 40th-floor Sky Lounge was pricey, but the food was great and service fast and friendly. Cons: -- No convenience store on premises...but in this neighborhood, none's really needed. -- Cheesy disposable cups for the in-room coffee maker, and no discernible recycling effort, in this otherwise Green hotel. -- 10 or 12 TV channels just aren't enough, according to the insomniac in our party. -- Powerful but noisy AC -- A label on the refrigerator warning of a $25 restocking fee scared us so badly we never even opened the darn thing. Which is probably just as well. -- The lobby is small, with utilitarian seating and minimal decor. If you like lounging around opulent lobbies and lobby bars, this is not your hotel. On the other hand, you'll be thrilled if you like getting from the front door to the elevator bank quickly, without navigating obstacles. For breakfast, walk two blocks to Cafe Lux on Michigan for amazing made-to-order beignets, great coffee, and a fantastic menu selection. It was the best breakfast we've ever had... try the blood orange mimosas and mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: king710
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 9-12. Overall our stay was very nice. We arrived a little before check in but they had our room ready. We were given a room on the 36th floor. The rooms are a tad tiny but for the time we were in it, the space was fine. The rooms have very large windows and our view was great. We could see the lake to our right, Gino's East right below, and the Magnificant Mile to the left. Our king bed was very comfortable. The shower/bathroom was a little small but we managed. We had problems with our wireless internet the first night but tech support walked us through. The air conditioners have sensors and kick on when you walk through the door. The elevators were pretty quick. Sometimes they were on the sluggish side but I never complained. The front desk was helpful when it wasn't real busy. We did ask for priority seating for Gino's East since there was a really long line and received that. 20 mins later we were seated!! We never went swimming but the water is heated and it has a great view. We also never had a chance to eat at the two restaurants. Parking is steep . . .$49/day, but that is Chicago. I wish they would offer some type of discount for hotel guests. Our last night there was also the worst. We had a group of young adults on our floor. When we seen security there once around 8:30 pm, we knew we might be in for a long night. About 1:00 am the group returned and were extremely loud, slamming doors, foul language, yelling/screaming at each other. We called security and they came up shortly after. They were warned. They were quiet for a little while and then a couple was outside our door arguing and yelling at each other. My husband then called security and they came a second time. Shortly thereafter the cops arrived. I'm not sure what happened but luckily I was able to go to sleep and tune it all out. I would have liked to see the hotel escort this whole group out of the hotel so the other guests could get some peace and quiet. A group shouldn't have to be warned more than once to be quiet. Also, I may have felt different if they sounded like they were having fun, but it was more fighting than anything. I really enjoyed my stay and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown locaton, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pugmama007
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Avenue. We were upgraded to a suite for our 5 night stay without even requesting it, and it made such a difference to have that extra room for this extended stay. The front desk, housekeeping and bell staff were very friendly and helpful at every encounter. The rooms are very clean and well furnished. I was sorry to leave our suite on the 30th floor on the last day because I knew our next stop would not be able to match the comfort and style we had at the Avenue Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajchi3
Reviews.Content: I booked my 4 night stay at the Avenue via lastminutetravel.com, total cost of US$430(incl. taxes) for a deluxe room. Upon check-in I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite on the 22nd floor. As some others have mentioned elevators were a little slow. My suite's living area included large leather couch, armchair, desk with ipod dock/speakers, flat screen TV, and tea/coffee station. Complimetary wireless internet access was a big plus and greatly appreciated. Bedroom was spacious, with a very comfortable bed and linens. Another flat screen TV, wardrobe and full elngth mirror. Lots of windows. Bathroom was clean and practical (hairdryer supplied), great toiletries - loved the body lotion! If anything I would say housekeeping supplied too many towels, they were always replaced and I ended up with 8 facewashers at the end of my stay, because I had to move them out of the way to use the shower and vanity. Small thing, but I hope they weren't all laundered uneccesarily. As some others have mentioned, it is a dark hotel. This is my only real complaint, the photos I've posted were taken with every light in the room on and they're still quite dark. As I spent time here sleeping it didn't phase me much, but if you needed to spend more time in the room this may be an issue. Rooftop bar and pool. It was quite cold during my stay so I didn't use the pool, but it looked like it would be nice for some sun in summer. Overall, a very pleasing stay. Staff were pleasant, hotel was roomy and clean. Location was convenient to Michigan Ave shopping, pizza resturants and Navy Pier (approx. 20-25 min walk to Art Institute in the South Loop). I was in town for a conference in the Loop but tried a Michigan Ave location for something different and quite enjoyed the daily walk (only a $5 cab ride if needed though).

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Snakebit12
Reviews.Content: I attended a recent business meeting held at the Avenue Hotel. I was very impressed the the attentiveness of the staff on check-in and the very spacious room. The bed was comfy and I didn't hear a peep from neighbors on any side. The location was terrific as well - one block or so off Michigan Avenue. Parking was alot but that's what parking is in Chicago. The meeting room was spacious and the staff was as attentive as at check-in with excellent service and refreshments. All in all, I was very pleasantly surprised as we normally use more "name" chains for our meetings. I would gladly consider this hotel for personal stays as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but a few kinks.”
Reviews.Author: Caesarsmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Hotel for a reunion the end of June. It was a busy weekend in Chicago and the hotel seemed to be hopping. I had a Junior Suite, which is actually an ADA room and there were only a few minor issues with the room. There was no hairdryer in the room, we had to call downstairs and one of the lights in the bathroom was out, but quickly replaced. The issues we found were the excessively long wait for the elevator. No matter when we were trying to catch the elevator it appeared as though only one was actually running and would be packed if it stopped on our floor. The other issue was the misleading nature of the booking. We booked on the hotels website because they were offering better package deals. However, their confirmation appears as though the credit card had been charged for full payment while the reality is it is merely a recognition of reservation. The full charge is due at check-out, which is fine, but they need to clear up the misleading communication.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, comfy bed, broken a/c, slow elevator”
Reviews.Author: discerning_guest_8
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised that after booking a great rate on hotwire, we had a 2-room suite with king bed! A/C in the room did not work at all - but we weren't in the room except to sleep. We didn't inform the front desk of this till we checked out. Wonderful large showerhead, big fluffy towels/sheets/blankets, leather sofa (!). Didn't swim in the pool but it looked like the people there were having fun. Elevators were frightfully slow on Sunday morning - our room was on the 17th floor and every elevator that stopped there was already crammed with other people checking out. We ended up hoofing it 17 flights down the steps! The location of this hotel can't be beat - steps from everything. Pub on ground floor was decent food/the opportunity to eat outside, and carries lots of different beers. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaBRIDE08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a good deal on priceline, considering a summer weekend in Chicago. At check-in, they ended up upgrading us to a corner 2 room suite on one of the top floors. We didn't even ask! The bed was very comfortable and it was amazing waking up to a wall of windows looking DT and to the lake. You couldn't beat the location of this hotel...a block away from North Michigan with shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, just don't get dirty!”
Reviews.Author: elsigwaldio
Reviews.Content: OUr stay in the Avenue was quite nice, the 2 queen bed studio suite is quite nice. Tv reception is poor, but the view and bedding more than make up for it!!! The english pub attached is reasonably priced and decent food. The lobby has an interesting design with somewhat annoying euro-pop techno music playing. The sky lounge seemed a bit small, but cozy. The ambiance is nice except the same music in lobby, plays there, loudly. The drink prices there were outrageous though, $9 for a rum and coke. I had to make sure one lasted awhile! The pool area was also small but nice. The pool was clean and nice and warm. Just a handy tip is that there is a dunkin donuts and a 7-11 two or three blocks down St Clair so you can save a little money there to dodge the breakfast costs in the hotel. The concierge was friendly and helpful in arranging the boat tour and just general getting around. This hotel is in fairly comfortable walking range of the Navy Pier, Ogden Slip (where some of the boat tours leave from) The Magnificent Mile, and Millennium Park. The room itself was spacious with a feeling of privacy even when sharing. The bathroom is a wonderful size, with plenty of space to change without standing in the splash of the shower. The shower though left much to be desired. The fixtures were loose against the wall and the pressure was dreadful. You would have better luck bathing in a water fountain. The water just dribbled out and never really left you feeling clean. Everything else about the bathroom was great. I'm not sure if the water pressure was poor due to being on the 34th floor or what, but I was glad I didn't take advantage of the weight room because I know I would have never gotten the sweat off of me. Outside the window you can hear the ambulances coming into Northwestern University Hospital, but its not too bad as it quiets down at night and if you're from another city, like I am, the sound kind of disappears. It was nice though to have free wireless internet! Overall we did have a pretty comfortable stay here, but I think the hotel needs a little bit more work, before it can really be as classy as its neighbors. I'd recommend a pianist for the sky lounge and make it a piano bar. Kill the lobby music all together so its easier to communicate with staff. Also figure out how to get more water to the top floors so the guests can feel clean and truly refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-Bad Business.”
Reviews.Author: Wrigley11
Reviews.Content: If you do stay at this hotel, be sure to walk from home (it's probably cheaper.) Parking is outrageous, and you will not be informed of this charge until after you check out of the hotel. If I had been informed of the extremely high rates to park my car, I would have taken a train or even parked somewhere else cheaper. Also they offer to check your bags for you, don't do it! It is such a cluster, that its easier to just hold onto them and lug them down Michigan Avenue yourself. Staff seems very disorganized and unfriendly. Great location, and that is just about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-That's about it...”
Reviews.Author: amypl77
Reviews.Content: Every year, I take my Mom downtown for Mother's Day weekend. We try to stay at a different hotel every time to experience all the fun things to do in Chicago. I decided on the Avenue hotel this year because of its location (which is excellent) and its price happened to be within my budget. I called the hotel directly to find out if they were doing anything special for Mother's Day as most hotels where we've stayed over the years have done. They explained to me that they had a special package deal that weekend (for an extra charge) that included complimentary brunch and mimosas. I thought, "My Mom will love that" and made my reservations. When we got there, we were immediately surprised at how small the lobby was compared to all the other places we have stayed in the city. When we got to our room, again, we were dissappointed by how small and dark it was. I had brought an expensive, special bottle of wine to share with my Mom over the weekend only to find that in order to keep it cold, I had to pay $25 for the USE of the refrigerator. Keep in mind, I wasn't planning on consuming anything FROM the refrigerator. The special wine is a tradition and I have NEVER been charged for the use of the refrigerator in any other hotel. The first morning, when we got up, we were excited about having our complimentary brunch and a mimosa and headed to the "Sky Lounge" to eat. The front desk had given us vouchers for the two days. The brunch was just ok (definitely not worth the extra money I paid). What really irked me though was, when we asked the semi-comatose and unfriendly "waiter" for our mimosas, he said, "Uh, we don't serve alcohol until after five." Now this is an orange juice-based drink (that we already paid for, mind you) and is traditionally drank during, I don't know, BRUNCH-THE TIME BETWEEN BREAKFAST AND LUNCH. We were very dissappointed as my Mom had her heart set on the extravagant drink. We ended up going down to the neighboring Elephant lounge and ordered them there. When we complained to the front desk, absolutely nothing was done. We weren't given our money back for the cost of the drinks (which would have been four total). Later that week, I contacted the manager who credited my credit card $50 for the mixup. Of course that was appreciated but it should have been addressed when we complained. The one bright spot was the concierge who was incredibly helpful in suggesting where to have dinner. All in all, it wasn't a horrible experience but it wasn't a memorable one. IF you're not planning on spending much time in your hotel room, the location is great. But if you're going for the whole stay/eat/drink experience, for the money, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Been there twice, just as nice”
Reviews.Author: ladyluckReno
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Avenue Hotel twice now. Once with my husband and son, and once for a girls weekend. Both times were fantastic! The location is what drew me to the hotel in the first place, right near all the great shopping! So the first time with my family, we had a big rooms with a so comfy king size bed for us, and a pullout couch for my son. He seemed fine with it! So we had almost the same layout with the girls, only two beds and a pull out! Big, clean room, flat TV, small bathroom, but that was fine. My husband enjoyed the free internet with his laptop. Service was wonderful! The checkin went smoothly, the same girl checked us in both times, very nice, and let me know about what the hotel offered. One of the best parts( of both trips) was the concierge. He was knowledgable, and both times made great recommendations for the family and the girls night out. We even got some free passes for the girls night out to Howl at the Moon, Martini Park(our two favorites) and more. He made our stay most enjoyable, as did the rest of the staff, the doorman Sami (funny guy) and the bartender in the lounge (small place but great views!) We already have a reservation for another girls weekend in September, and have contacted Vern the concierge for more information! We can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth Full Price, Not 4-Star”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Around2
Reviews.Content: PROS: Location is fabulous. It is right off of Magnificent Mile, and very close to Starbucks, Corner Bakery, Dunkin', 7-11. We walked everywhere (except the zoo) and didn't feel we were far. They offer free wireless (not typical at other four-stars). Great showerheads and the curved shower curtain rod that gives you more room in the shower (typical at other four-stars). Luggage storage before and after check-out (typical at other four-stars) They upgraded us to a suite without asking (corner room with two walls of windows!). They are available through Hotwire, which means you do not have to (and you should not) pay full price. CONS: While the superficial furnishings seemed somewhat new (bed linens, decor), the deeper elements seemed old and tired (baseboards, tile, public bathrooms on the second floor). Overall, I felt that I was staying in an old building that had been superficially spruced up to try and meet a four-star level. There is no proper concierge or concierge desk (if there is, it is hidden). It seems that the front desk staff doubles as concierges. The day we checked in we asked for information about the river architectural tours (seemingly one of the more popular tourist activities in the city). We waited a few minutes while two staff members rifled through a desk to find brochures. In the end, they could not find anything. One of them very kindly gave us a map and directions to the site of one of the tour companies--that was very helpful. I, do, however, expect more from a four-star hotel. A proper concierge at a proper four-star hotel would have booked the tour for me or at least had ready access to brochures and detailed information. Housekeeping came into our room without knocking about 2 hours before check-out time (we were checking out at the regular check-out time for all guests). The bed was very, very uncomfortable--it sloped in the middle and tilted toward the head. The staff, while friendly, were not as professional/formal as I'd expect from a four-star hotel in one of the largest cities in the country. The exception was one gentleman at the front desk who might have been Mik, the general manager. The lotion in the bathroom had a seal, and the seal was broken. I don't usually see seals on hotel bathroom amenities, but when there is a seal and it's broken, it makes you feel like you are using used lotion... Would I stay here again? I would really prefer not to, even with the discounted Hotwire price. Expect 3- or 3.5-star level if you go. It was just OK (the bed was definitely bad). A four-star hotel should be better than "just OK".

Reviews.Title: “My birthday!”
Reviews.Author: ButterScotchRum
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends surprised me and took me to Chicago for my birthday weekend and we stayed in the lavish hotel, "The Avenue." Words cannot express how dazzled I was with, "The Avenue!" From the time we pulled up to check in, everyone had their hand/arm out to assist us, with a smile! We felt very welcomed! Check-in was quick and easy, elevators were quick with a smooth ride and the rooms were very clean, spacious and up to date. We had such a great time, we're going back for, "The Taste of Chicago," in July and to host a bachelorette party for our girlfriend, as well as another birthday celebration in September! I can't get enough of this place! Oh, and did I mention how cozy the beds are? :-)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our stay special”
Reviews.Author: jimhawthorn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Avenue Hotel Chicago for my wedding anniversary. Friend of mine who recently stayed there recommended the hotel and I have decided to give it a try. Upon arrival, I was greeted by their doorman who was very friendly. Then to my surprise, when I was checking in with my wife, front desk agent congratulated us on our anniversary and offered me a complimentarty upgrade to lovely suite. I only mentioned purpose of my stay during reservation when I was asked purpose of my visit and I guess reservation agent went above and beyond to relay this message to the front desk. At check out, I was once again thanked for spending my anniversary with Avenue hotel by the desk agent and I just couldn't resist but to post this review to thank the staff at Avenue Hotel for making my anniversary extra special this year.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: darkesong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Chicago and I really can't say enough good about it. The only bad part was they gave us the wrong room at the very beginning but it was easily corrected. We stayed in one of the lakeview suites and it was a very nice,well appointed room with comfortable furniture, top of the line toiletries and excellent views. The location was wonderful, we spent one day wandering through all the nearby shops and a second day we walked to Navy Pier. I would recomend taking taxis to anything outside walking distance as traffic can be "interesting" in that area. We never made it up to the Sky Lounge so I can't comment on that but the room service was good and the Elephant & Castle pub was excellent. All of the staff we encountered was courteous and friendly. We're hoping to go back to Chicago next year for a longer stay and The Avenue will certainly be our choice for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fishoutofwater66
Reviews.Content: I booked the room on Priceline and called the hotel to get upgraded to a kids room. There was an extra charge for this, but it was worth it. The room was large and it had a Wii. My kids ages 3 and 6 loved it. They also liked the kids amenities in the room. While the parking was expensive, we liked the hotel and the location. We were not that familiar with Chicago and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. If I was going to stay there again, i would not go to the adjoining restaurant, the Elephant and Castle. It was overpriced and the both the food and the service were bad. The Corner Bakery is only a block away and it is a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed- Location is it's only positive note!”
Reviews.Author: lanestar7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night for our anniversary and will not be returning! The clerk who checked us in could not care less if we were there. She wasn't even going to ask us or tell us what kind of room we were getting. She never smiled or told us to have a nice stay, no pleasantries at all! The elevators were old and small. One was broken when we stopped at the fitness floor to look around. It was all dark with the doors stuck open a little below the floor level. Kind of scared us to get back on another one!! Everything in this hotel is extra! They have a fridge in the room with snacks and drinks that are $4-$5 apiece but the kicker is that if you take one, it not only costs that price but also a $25 restocking fee!!! So that one Coke will cost $29!!!! Parking is still $48 but with unlimited in and outs. It did take the valet 20 minutes to get our car though so it's not real speedy. Better call down and alert them before you go down yourself! Internet is an extra charge, if you want your own fridge it's an extra charge (I was scared to use the lotion provided for us in the bathroom! I am still watching my credit card for a $20 charge for that one squirt of lotion!!) The welcome book in the room says there are vending machines in the building but we asked the comatose front desk attendant and she referred us to the Walgreens 2 blocks away. Convienent!! We came and went several times over our one night stay and we were NEVER greeted by any lobby staff. Once I was given the stink eye by a guard after I smiled and said HI to him!! We stayed at the Palmer the last anniversary and will be going back there from now on. They were like our family compared to how we were treated at this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MargaretKinner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avenue Hotel in May. I wouldn't have been able to afford this place if I booked right on the actual hotel website. I went through booking.com and got the room (2 queen sized beds on the 22nd floor) for only $99 bucks a night! Great location though. We walked everywhere! Room was clean and the view was pretty awesome. It was great to have The Elephant and Castle (the Pub) right in the lobby of the hotel, they had an excellent beer selection, and super friendly staff. OH and the beds were really comfortable too! Parking, however, was a nightmare. The parking at the actual hotel was 48 dollars a night... OUCH! We elected to park at the public lot next door (the hospital lot) that was 34 dollars a night.. and for the 50 hours I was in Chicago it cost me $104 for parking. They charge PER DAY opposed to PER HOUR. Watch for this..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: cubbieblue10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a short getaway after our wedding as we aren't going to be taking our actual honeymoon until this summer. Overall I thought this hotel was a fantastic value for what we got. We have stayed many places in the downtown Chicago area, from the way overpriced Hyatt Regency on Wacker to much smaller hotels like the Rafaello and Allerton. I decided I will do this review as a pros and cons list. Pros: -Great value. We paid $108.00 to stay in a king bed suite - you don't easily find this in the city. -The room. The bed was fantastically comfortable. We spent many hours just laying in it and staring out the picture window. Also, the sleeper sofa in the living room was nice to pull out and watch a movie from, although not too comfortable. -Location. Half a block east of Michigan Ave. is great. Also close to the Chicago Red Line stop if you want to go elsewhere in the city. -The view. We were on the 36th floor in a corner suite looking south. I haven't had a better view of the city from any hotel. Cons: (some of these are pretty picky details) -The TV in the bedroom was an old tube TV of about 24 inches. An upgrade would be nice. -The toilet was *very* loud in the bathroom. Easily enough to wake me up at night. It seemed I could hear it from other rooms as well. -The heating and AC seemed a little strange. We had it set to 65 to try to cool the room and there was heat coming out. It seemed to stay at a comfortable temp, but not what it was set to. -Parking. I have seen many people complain about $48.00 for parking. This is common for valet in the city, anywhere from $40-50. Park a block east at the hospital and you'll pay less than $20 per day. All in all for what is rated as a 3-star hotel this was a fantastic stay. I would definitely go here again, maybe just bring earplugs to sleep with. The staff was great and as a whole it was a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feel ripped-off”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5in5states
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful one-bedroom suite, a little small but for the price a GREAT deal. The bathroom was really too small, however, and I had to call down twice for more clothes hangers. But what really got me was the $48 per day to park my car, which was not disclosed beforehand, and ended up costing as if I stayed an extra night. That said, I would stay there next time if I didn't have a car.....

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: copi10
Reviews.Content: Having seen so many places where they rip you off and provide bad service in return, I must say this hotel finally is the exact opposite. The value for money is just great, staff is never arrogant but always helpful and friendly. Beds are great, if you order room service the portions are big and they charge you not more than you would be charged in any restaurant around the corner. It's good to say that places like this still exist !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: jackieog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Avenue Hotel on the Miracle Mile in Chicago for 1 night recently. The room was great, fabulous king sized bed, lovely furnishings with a full sized desk and flat screen tv. The bathroom was small but adequate and really appreciated the hairdryer and additional magnifying mirror. Parking steep at $48, but found a place on Ontario St about 2 blocks away, around the corner from Trader Joes (another perk) for $32. The bed was really great, we both slept like babies! We had friends staying at the Omni - literally across Michigan Avenue from us and they preferred our room. Believe me, we definitely got the better deal! If you manage to get a great deal - like under $100.00 it's definitely the place to stay! The location was excellent also and you could walk everywhere. The Elephant and Castle adjacent was great for breakfast. The Sky Bar was very nice, but it was a cloudy day when we were there, but we sat by the fire to dry off and it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for your North Michigan Ave. adventure”
Reviews.Author: DavidHenry
Reviews.Content: Very nice place one block off of Michigan Avenue. Only a few blocks from Water Tower Place, Gino's East and many other great places to shop and eat. My 3 co-workers and I spent 3 days during a conference. We had no trouble finding good food and entertainment within walking distance. We recommend Jake Melnicks (casual sports bar w/ great food), ESPN Zone, Corner Bakery, and the Elephant and Castle, a great British restaurant and pub right next to the hotel. Get the breakfast with Irish bangers (sausages). As for the hotel, we had a mix of rooms, mostly great. One was just OK size wise, and 3 were larger suites with wonderful views of downtown and\or Lake Michigan. Make sure to ask reservations staff to get the room size and view that you want. Reservations staff was very accommodating - our non-profit group received a free upgrade (to suites) from their friendly staff - how nice! Rooms were very clean and modern. Beds were very comfortable. There are only eight rooms on each floor so sleeping was easy. It was quiet considering the proximity to Northwestern Memorial and Michigan Avenue. You're not going to get away from the noise in this immediate neighborhood. Wireless internet access was free and worked fine. Parking is valet only. Car was always available within 5 minutes of request and valet staff was great. I would spend the few dollars extra. Self park is one block away and very tempting, but it is a pain to haul your stuff back and forth. Front desk staff was helpful and attentive, except upon arrival. I checked in around 10pm on 4/5 and that registration person was indifferent. Everything else was very good. I would go back again. I think my kids would like a shot at the outdoor pool when the weather gets a bit warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: GoSpartans
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation for The Avenue Hotel through priceline bidding $79.00/night for a four star hotel in downtown Chicago. The hotel only has valet parking for $49.00/night. The location of the hotel is fabulous -- 1/2 block off Michigan Avenue and within close (2 to 5 blocks) walking distance to great shopping, restaurants, and some tourist attractions such as the John Hancock Observatory. The lobby is small -- but you are greeted promptly by the doorman who arranges for valet parking as well as the person who handles baggage valet. Check in was smooth and took all of about 3-minutes. We were in our room on the 36th floor within 10-minutes of pulling up in front of the hotel. We did not eat in the restaurants or visit the Sky Bar, so I cannot comment on that, but my son did order a cheeseburger and fries from room service one night. The price was reasonable for room service in a major city, and the service was fast and food fresh. My teenage son did call me on my cell phone from the room, and the charges were outrageous. He dialed the wrong number once for $10.95, reached my voicemail once for another $10.95, and talked to me for 3-minutes for $15.00. Ouch! We asked for a room on a high floor and received it. We faced the city (not the water) and the children enjoyed the view and marveled at how high up we were (36th floor.) The room itself was medium sized and tastefully decorated in browns, beiges, and ice blue (up-to-date color scheme and furnishings.) The beds were comfortable with down comforters and pillows. There was a mini-bar ($4 for an 8 ounce Coke.) On the second night we realized that there was a 7/11 store within 2 blocks, so bought our drinks there before turning in for the night. The TV was a 32 inch flat screen, and there was a coffee maker in the room that made single cups from pods. The bathroom was a nice size and clean -- with the bowed shower rod for extra room in the shower. The hairdryer was high quality, the toilletries were sparse for three people, but I'm sure we could have asked form more. Our room was very quiet. I did not hear people in the hallway or doors slamming. It must be well insulated. The heater in our room, however, was quite noisy, and I put a pillow over my head to muffle the noise as I was falling to sleep. Overall, this was a very positive experience. The price I paid for the location and quality was a steal, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend getaway experience!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyfansCanada
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Avenue Hotel Chicago. When we checked in we asked if we could be in a room that was fairly close to our friends that came with us. They immediately accommodated our request & upgraded us both to 2 suites on the 25th floor. Rooms were very elegant & obviously just recently redecorated. The bed was the most comfortable bed we've slept in with great bedding & great pillows!!! We walked a couple of blocks to the Water Tower Place & enjoyed great shopping there as well as in the vicinity. Had breakfast a couple of mornings at the little bakery/cafe just down the street which was very convenient & not too expensive. Only negative thing was the cost to park our vehicle for 3 nights - $48 per night! Ouch!!! Otherwise, a very enjoyable stay & would recommend to anyone travelling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great!”
Reviews.Author: sbergwil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Avenue Hotel for 3 nights in late March and couldn't have asked for a better experience! Although our room wasn't ready when we arrived slightly before 3, the bellman stored our bags while we went out to sightsee. When we returned 45 minutes later, we were so pleased with our room on the 19th floor. In addition to the king bed, there was a leather couch, desk, plasma TV, small table with a coffeemaker and still lots of extra space including a walk-in closet! The bathroom was excellent with lots of counterspace, fantastic "rain" shower, and great eco-friendly products. The bed was really comfortable with great bedding. The staff was very friendly and always greeted us when we returned. Since there aren't many rooms on each floor, there wasn't much hallway noise or doors slamming. Be sure to visit the Sky Bar. The views are fantastic and Deacon the bartender makes some great martinis! We had dinner in the Elephant & Castle on the first floor one night as well. The food was delicious and the beer selection was excellent. The location is terrific for shopping as well as catching buses to the museums and other parts of town. In addition, taxis were plentiful and relatively inexpensive. We chose to save a little money and did the self-park across St. Clair Ave. from the hotel. In addition, we ate breakfast at The Corner Bakery just down the street instead of eating at the hotel. The only problem was an additional charge on our bill which was immediately cleared up when I called the front desk. We will definitely stay at The Avenue Hotel the next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great views, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Geo313
Reviews.Content: We (6) stayed 2 nights at the AVE and they were great...the service was great, the employees very helpful and kind, and the rooms were amazing! the contemporary styling in the lobby, rooms, and sky lounge was very cool...the rooms were clean, huge for a big city hotel, the views from our room on the 26th floor were amazing...i absolutely loved this hotel and plan on staying at the AVE every trip i take to chicago! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, but isn't yet”
Reviews.Author: AndreaLP81
Reviews.Content: We're from Chicago, and found The Avenue on Hotwire. Had we paid the full price ($140/night, as opposed to $75/night on Hotwire), we would have been very disappointed. A lot of little things added up to make The Avenue less than the 4-star hotel that it's rated. Bathroom fixtures were loose and the shower was poor. The toilet reminded us of a public restroom stool. The baseboards, furniture and doors were scuffed and dirty. The room did a poor job of muffling the city noise, even at 25 stories. On the other hand, they do a lot of things right. The bedding was fantastic. The staff and service were quite good. The Sky Lounge was impressive, feels exclusive (in the good way) and reasonably priced. For people who want to explore the Mag Mile and the Gold Coast, you can't beat the location. We discovered that breakfast the the adjacent Elephant and Castle restaurant was exactly the same as breakfast served from room service, but at half the price. As a recent conversion from a mid-range hotel in Chicago, The Avenue is trying to be a 4-star hotel and has the potential to be a 4-star hotel, but as of this visit, it was not.

Reviews.Title: “From now on, I'll check the Avenue Hotel FIRST for rates and availability in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: My niece, her friend, and I took the Hiawatha train from Milwaukee for this one-night shopping/museum excursion to Chicago. This was our first stay at the Avenue, but I don't think it will be our last! The great location (just 1/2 block from the Magnificent Mile), coupled with the spacious, well-appointed rooms, friendly service, and handy dining options, added to our enjoyment of the MLK weekend. The views from the Sky Lounge were wonderful, and we topped off our Saturday night with martinis by the fireplace. We also enjoyed a hearty breakfast at the Elephant & Castle. We made use of the iPod dock and enjoyed the sweeping city views from our junior king suite. Even with the sleeper-sofa in use, there was plenty of room to move about. We unanimously agreed that we would return to this hotel in the future without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: vikingBeijing77
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Hotwire and thatâ€™s how I found the hotel actually â€“ didnâ€™t know of it before. Room was on the smaller side, but was changed to bigger room the second night. As with many hotels, breakfast was expensive and avoided that the following days. Best asset of this hotel it its very good location, with walking distance to Watertower and the good rate I got. Listed as 4 star and would rate that as â€œkindâ€� to the property, as it is a older hotel â€“ missed slippers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_Traveller72
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a one day teaching symposium this past week and had originally had a reservation at the Red Roof Inn in the same part of town because it was close to where I needed to go and the price was right. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to give Priceline a try. I put in what I was paying at the Red Roof, said I only wanted a 4-star hotel, and to my surprise, my price was accepted by the Avenue Hotel. Checking out its website, I was immediately excited! My short stay didn't disappoint me. I arrived around 11 pm since my train didn't arrive until 10.30 pm. Check in was quick, efficient and friendly. The receptionist asked if my conference was in the hotel. When I told her no, she got out a map and asked me where it was so that she could give me directions. That was a very nice touch. She also asked me for a wake up call. It was nice to have someone anticipate my needs so that I didn't have to get to my room and call back down, or search for directions the next morning.
