The room itself was on the 21st floor (Room 2101). The room is right by the service elevator, and I did hear it running occasionally. It didn't bother me, but some may find it an annoyance. I found the decore and linens to be very nice. The desk was large, which I like in a hotel, but it was a bit wobbly. The next morning, I got a wake up call on time from a real person, which I thought was a very nice touch. I loved the pod coffee maker in the room. Check out was a breeze in the room with a receipt immediately e-mailed to me. (By the way, wireless internet is free, which is great. I hate paying a lot for a hotel and then having to shell out another 10 to 15 dollars to get internet.) I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Luxury like site claims but ok”
Reviews.Author: familyfunfinder123
Reviews.Content: The hotel's site marked it as a 4star LUXURY hotel. It is a clean hotel but no different than a moderate chain hotel. The details and pictures are gravely decieving. The lobby is basically an office elevator corridor with podiums serving as you ck in/out. A closet literaly serves as the hotel office. There is no curb appeal or interior ambience. The rooms are old but refurbished and the beds with down alternative are a plus. I'm not sure where the 1st picture of the exercise room is but the 7th floor one could use some light, hand weights, and larger towels. It is very minimal. If you just want a decent place to sleep then book here. If you want a feeling of ahhhh from the front door to your room and for the same price keep looking. The location is good for Michigan Av activities but so are a dozen others.I wish I had chosen a different one. To me a hotel is rated LUXURY when the rooms, staff and amenities are above average. For example, when there was a problem at ck in (confirmed 2 rooms hotel only had 1 listed) the agent fixed it but she never communicated what she was doing. She just kept staring at her computer and typing. She was not a people person and I was a calm/tired customer. Frankly I don't think she knew what she was doing. After 45 minutes wait @ 10pm we got rooms. Why the wait?? I was never told but I found out. The heat was not working (-5 outside) and all 5 weary travelers had to stay in other room for 2 1/2 hours until warm enough to sleep in. The other was the bellman. I've determined that he must not need his job b/c he didn't do it. We (5) crawled out of the taxi retreived our luggage, paid the driver and got a receipt and NEVER saw the bellman. He was inside leaning against a wall. He never moved even after 3 groups ck'd in while we waited for our rooms. He did not help at ck out either. We hailed our own cabs everyday. Like I said the hotels just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stainlessMadisonWi
Reviews.Content: Great location and great hotel. The room was a good size for a large city hotel. Comfortable bed and pillows, good coffee in room, checked in early with no problem, great views of Michigan Ave. I will stay here again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great, just ok”
Reviews.Author: shannymo88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Avenue from 12/30/08 through 1/3/09, and honestly I would rate this hotel as just 'ok'. It wasn't bad, but there wasn't anything special about it. We stayed on the 26th floor, and the room was clean enough and roomy enough for two. One drawback was that the hotel is right next to a hospital, so you do hear sirens all night, even being up that many stories high. Obviously not the hotel's fault, but still a minor annoyance. The beds were the best part of the room; they were super soft and we wanted to bring them home with us! Some other flaws with the room: the bathtub didn't drain, so you had to take a quick shower to avoid the tub filling up fast. And second, the hooks on the back of the bathroom doors fell right off if you put anything on them, so there was nowhere to hang clothing or towels. Actually, this bathroom had the least amount of places to put things than any hotel I've ever been in! So that's one suggestion I would make to the management staff at the hotel; a lot of people like it when the bathrooms have some small shelving or places to hang things. One good point about the staff...when we asked for something, they came with it right away. The concierge was also helpful in making calls to find us a restaurant of our liking. Other things worth mentioning: There was no mini fridge in the room, and that was $20 extra if you requested one. We would have liked to have one, but we didn't want to spend the extra money. Also, anything that you take from the snack fridge provided was $20 to replace, so that $4 pack of cookies could potentially turn pretty expensive! We found a corner store nearby to get water and snacks at a much more reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “My future home away from home”
Reviews.Author: fiusun79
Reviews.Content: what a pleasant surprise. I was recommended to this hotel from a friend who stayed there before and decided to give them a try. I usually stay with major chain brand due to their reputatation but the Avenue hotel convince me to try more of independent hotels for my future accomodation needs. Location was unbeatable and price was more than reasonable. Product and service was superb. I usually do not write review or fill out comment cards but this time I felt obligate to share my experience. Reservation agent was very friendly and accomodating. Front desk agents and doormen greeted me like I was one of the VIP. Room was very large compare to some of the hotels in the area and everything seemed brand new. I plan on coming back to Chicago area very soon and I plan on making the Avenue hotel home away from home for me.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience at avenue hotel-chicago”
Reviews.Author: a112341
Reviews.Content: I'm living in this avenue hotel chicago right now at dec 12th 2008. this hotel has extremely bad service. I called them to bring two spoons to for my icecream so i called the house keeping to bring me two siliver spoons. A women answered the phone and said how many would you like? I said two, the women replied surprisingly "only two, are you serious (ridiculous tone)?" i said yes please. waited for 20 mintues and i called again for the spoons. the same women answered the phone and said "wait for another 15minutes ok?". Didnt eat my icecream at the end. i said thank you to the person who delivered the spoons to me and he grunted. Other thing is the minibar are autosensored. I took a diet coke out of the minibar. After realizing its $25 i put the diet coke back in.they still charged me the $25 without even drinking it. the little note that said $25/per drink is so tiny that you would normally skip to see. Overall the room looks nice, but the lobby is bad. the photos are overrated. Strongly not recommending anyone to come here. i rather go to marriot or peninsula (just right next door).

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nenie99
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a memorable stay at the Avenue. I arrived on a Chilly November Chicago evening and immediately warmed under the glow of their fabulous fireplace and hospitality. The location is Prime and being on a business trip, I enjoyed the ability to walk to both meetings and wonderful shopping. My large chic room was equipped with wireless connectivity, a large Imac (although I had my Laptop) and a nice size flat screen, which made working in my room a convenience. The view from my room was wonderful and the bed and linens were quite comfortable. Sammy the doorman was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Stolen watch at the Avenue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: portlog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recently renovated, the staff tries to do a good job. The hotel doesnÂ´t have safety deposit boxes in the rooms. During our stay, my wife left her running watch in one of the drawers inside a pouch. Her watch were stolen. The hotel manager said he couldnÂ´t do anything. We are talking about $250.00 US. We paid much more for our stay. The least they could do is pretend that they care and give you a couple nights credit on your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay- Especially for Northwestern Hospital”
Reviews.Author: myred86
Reviews.Content: I recently, unexpectedly needed a room near Northwestern Memorial Hospital. With no reservation, I went to the front desk in the evening and was helped by Nanaly (I think that is how it is spelled). She was very gracious and arranged a room for me at a great rate even though the hotel was very full. She was also able to extend my stay when I needed it. Even though it was a standard room, it was very large for downtown Chicago. Very quiet and perfect for what I needed. I was there for a family member in the hospital, so I didn't get to check out all of the amenities. The location can't be beat- just walk across the street to the hospital. The restaurant in the lobby was very good too- good food and fast service. I ate there several times. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Avenue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaStyle
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I stayed for 3 nights last year when it was a Radisson. And, had to come back for 3 nights again this year. The upgrades to the hotel are wonderful. I had a corner suite on the 26th floor this year with a magnificent view of Michigan Avenue. The room had a large sitting area and bedroom. The hotel is in a great location you can walk everywhere. Verne the Avenue's concierge was a tremendous help with booking the city / river boat tour and tickets for Second City. Breakfast on the rooftop that was superb, it was very relaxing to see the skyline while eating breakfast and enjoying an espresso. Everyone was very helpful. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Ellegance”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Chicago the weekend of Sept. 27. When we arrived, the hotel manager was in the lobby and greeted us, asking how we were. We replied that we were tired due to some delays with Amtrak. Without being asked, she offered us a larger, upgraded room for no additional charge. I was impressed that she would offer without being asked to, but found it to be a welcome upgrade. We got to our room and were pleasantly surprised. The room was decorated very contemporary and had a very nice leather couch and large desk and leather chair. The bed, a king size pillowtop, was so cushy and comfy. It was absolute heaven!! The upscale linens and feather pillows and down comforter were sublime. The bathroom was also very nicely appointed with marble countertops and travertine tiled shower. We almost didn't want to leave our room it was just that nice. Hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to any and every thing you could imagine. We will definatley stay at the Avenue again if we ever visit Chicago again. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Avenue.”
Reviews.Author: RLSSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August. Great central location walking distance of shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. Clean & comfortable, quite spacious. Friendly staff. Small roof-top pool. The rooms are very modern but a little dark. Did hear ambulance noise at various times during the night on a few of the nights (hospital nearby) but it didn't worry us too much as the central location and introductory prices made it worth the small inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “We love Avenue Hotel Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: JoniVColorado
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went on girlâ€™s weekend shopping trip and stayed at Avenue Hotel Chicago. We truly loved the hotel! Everyone was friendly and helpful. The location was close to fabulous shopping (American Girl Place, Disney Store, Chanel, Boss, Brooks Brothersâ€¦to name a few) and great restaurants. We decided to get a kid-friendly room and we were so pleased with it. The room was bright and comfy and we had a ball with the Wii! We are planning on returning closer to the holidays and will definitely stay at Avenue Hotel Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at The Avenue”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleGail
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful weekend in Chicago and a very pleasant stay at The Avenue. I found a great deal at hotels.com and was a little apprehensive that I might get a less desirable room as a result. However, the very pleasant and personable young man at reception gave us a very nice room on the 31st floor and even let us check in early. I was very impressed with the size, decor and amenities and would definitely return. By the way, we like Panera Bread for breafast, and there is one on Fairbanks about five blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience - I can certainly recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel contributed to the positive memories I have from my first experience in Chicago. I organized in their premises a two-day business conference early Aug 2008 for 13 people. Centrally located, affordable room (Corp rate), a very engaged personnel from the concierge to the business representatives, Avenue Hotel Chicago is a great deal. Christine, the Sales & Catering Manager with whom I organized my event, was available, always ready to help and find solutions. I was also impressed by the fantastic upgraded room I was granted: broad stylish room with a large bed, big flat screen TV, I-pod reader, personal coffee machine, iron board, couch and armchairâ€¦and a nice view on the skyscrapers around are just some of the features I can rememberâ€¦. There is also a pool on the roof. I did not use it but went up to look at the view on the sea. In summary a Great experience. I can only recommend it. I would go back there when I have to be in Chicago. Any down side? None really. Front desk a bit confused when checking out and maybe not the quickest. As a foreigner I was just hammered by the amount of taxes: once you add the service charges, sales taxesâ€¦ you come up to a 30% increase in your base price. But this is local practice. One has to adjust to it I guessâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kelbel316
Reviews.Content: This trip was a last minute one for us so I was looking for a hotel at a reasonable price. My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night over Labor Day weekend for my birthday. The price we paid for just the standard room was well below others that I had looked at in the area (which is a great location by the way). The entire staff was friendly and we didn't have any problems at all checking in. Checking in was very quick and easy. I booked the room directly through the hotel website. The elevators were fast, our room was neat and clean, and the view was great. We were only here for one night so we didn't get a chance to go to the pool and the Sky Lounge was open yet but the Elephant and Castle bar was amazing! They had a great beer selection and the service was quick and friendly. Best part (in our opinion) of our stay at The Avenue was going to Elephant and Castle located just by the front doors in the lobby of the hotel. The bathroom in our room was decent-sized and had a shelf by the sink for extra room which I loved because I'm not a light packer. The water pressure in the shower was just right and had some space for extra products if needed. The only thing about the bathroom was in our room the hot was cold and the cold was hot in the shower which was confusing at first. The bed was a little on the hard side but the down pillows and blankets made up for it in my mind. Overall I didn't have any complaints about this hotel! The location is very nice and the price was even better compared to some other hotels in the area. I was only disappointed that the Sky Lounge was not open yet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent training meeting at the Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Friendly_Coordinator
Reviews.Content: The event went wonderful at the Avenue. The attendees sent many compliments regarding the hotel, rooms, food, & organization. The staff was helpful in organizing the event & all of the last minute changes that took place. The location was ideal. Of course, the wonderful weather during that weekend & the air show were a definite plus! In addition, we scheduled a dinner cruise on the Odyssey which was excellent. Our German colleagues were quite impressed with the fireworks display :)

Reviews.Title: “Compare it to others first ...”
Reviews.Author: HM01970
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the rooftop pool and the location when we booked. Upon arrival, it was a long wait to check in, and when we retrieved our bags from the storage room - the bell person gave us the wrong bag (luckily we are honest -- else someone would be out a lap top). The roof top pool was cool, but small and not really decorated at all. The room was decent, nice bedding, and clean. The "business center" had only 2 computers, which were busy a lot so prepare for a wait. The elevators were antiquated - but functional. If it matters to you that the front desk staff are friendly -- this is not the spot to stay. They barely said as much as hello each time we passed by.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Services”
Reviews.Author: bleggett
Reviews.Content: Customer service is so bad. If you need anything for your room don't ecpect to get any help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AZyoung
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel is in a great location that's convenient for walking to restaurants and attractions. The hotel rooms are large and clean with a nice leather sofa, desk, and plasma tv. The Bed was extremely comfortable and clean with loads of nice pillows. Small indoor pool, there were a lot of screaming kids so I decided to bypass the pool. Elevators were slow, but overall this was a great place to stay and I would stay here again. The Elephant and Castle pub next door had great food, large portions, reasonably priced with lots of beer choices and great margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “great experience...will definitely choose again”
Reviews.Author: angelia4
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the things I am looking for in Chicago hotel...great decor, fabulous location just steps away from Michigan Ave... great service. Best of all great bed/bedding...a deal breaker for me....highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience in a While Here”
Reviews.Author: Caseyamcl
Reviews.Content: I've been to Chicago eight times in the past seven years, and this hotel ranks #1 for me, tied with the much more expensive InterContinental. The fact that they upgraded the room to a corner suite for our honeymoon at no extra charge didn't hurt. The view from the 34th floor is great. The rooftop pool is nice, the Elephant Bar downstairs is lively, and the service desk has been responsive to every request we have happened to make over the past three days. The location has been great, too. A block from shopping (for the wife), and about a 5 minute walk from the loop. All in all, I'll be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Pet Friendly Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dmaestas
Reviews.Content: I was luckily enough to find a great, pet friendly hotel in Chicago on "Bring Fido.com". I stayed at the Avenue Hotel Chicago and had a terrific experience with my bischon, Mickey. The rooms were very large so I didn't feel bad leaving Mickey. There was a great walking area right by Lake Michigan, only 2 blocks over. The hotel was convenient to everything and although they accept pets you would never know it. It was very quiet and comfortable. I would highly recommend Avenue Hotel Chicago for anyone looking for a dog friendly hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel, Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSamantha
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, husband and two kids) stayed at the Avenue for a weekend getaway. We wanted a great hotel that was right in the heart of Mag Mile and the Avenue did not disappoint! As we pulled up, the valet greeted us immediately and hustled our bags inside. The woman at the registration desk was friendly, quick and efficient. We were up in our room in no time! We had booked a regular guest room with some reservations, as there were four of us and weâ€™ve had bad experiences with cramped downtown hotel rooms, but decided to go ahead as the Avenue claims to have extra-spacious rooms. They did not disappoint us! The room was very large, clean and impressively decorated, with a wonderful king-sized bed, sofa sleeper, desk with chair, large flat-screen television and lots of room to spread out and get comfy. They also had a docking station for my sonâ€™s iPod and free wireless Internet access, something my husband appreciated very much. We all enjoyed the rooftop pool and sundeck immensely. The views from the 40th floor were amazing! All of the staff was very friendly and helpful when asked for suggestions for other places to dine. The location could not be beat! It was literally steps to Michigan Avenue and close to many of our favorite places to visit downtown, including American Girl Place. We had a great experience with this hotel and will not hesitate to come back, whether with the kids or for an adults-only weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: murphym35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and they follow that up with an outstanding stay. Good size to the rooms for having 2 queen beds in them - extremely comfortable! Nice amenities such as a one cup coffee maker and flat screen television. Elephant Bar in the hotel is great for late night fare as well as a good choice for breakfast. Close to lake, shopping and nightlife - all for the cheapest rate (at least right now) on Michigan Ave!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: TK866
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 day conference and had nothing but problems from the moment I checked in. Twice on the first day my room key got deactivated - and it was never near a credit card or cell phone! It wasnt only me either, people in line next to me were having the same problem and the hotel staff claimed to not know of anyone else experiencing the same issue. Then it turns out the a/c wasnt working correctly in my room and all that came out was humid air. When I got back to my room it was fixed but the smoke detector was taken off the wall and was hanging down with the wires out. That night I discovered a huge swarm of bugs above the bed! The hotel staff immediately assumed I had opened the windows (which I didnt because my view was of construction) but reassigned me to another room - at 1 am. Then I bought internet service for my room with the wireless keyboard that was provided, but not a single website worked. The a/c units are also terribly noisy (no matter what temp air is coming out of them). It is so inconvinient to get to the business center and fitness center because you have to take 2 sets of elevators. I found out it used to be a radisson so maybe it explains some of it - but dont waste your time or money here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredGrandville_MI
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the "new" Avenue Hotel was far better than we could have imagined. The staff was super friendly and extremely helpful. Many of the great staff from the Radison days are still there. The rooms are freshly remodeled from when the hotel was a Radison and they are spectacular. This is definately a must try hotel if you visit downtown Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “best stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: shawnthavirgo
Reviews.Content: the rooms were so clean, and that is a big plus in my book. i can truly say that i will stay there time and time again, your front desk staff has been upggraded very well also.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Chicago Magnificent Mile
HotelInfo.Address: 160 East Huron, Chicago, IL 60611
